review.title: Ok not great
review.reviewText: Hotel noisy and false advertising about view.  Late check out policy was very inconvenient

review.title: Bike distance to Golden Gate
review.reviewText: Staff=excellent, breakfast= a cup of coffee+donuts, traffic noise, flies, parking=double parking expected
review.positiveRemarks: convenience to Golden Gate Bridge and a great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast and flies

review.title: Affordable motel near Fishermans Warf
review.reviewText: We were comfortable in our stay. Free parking. VERY nice young man at front desk. It is walking distance to Fisherman's Warf AND nice eateries on Union Street.
Overall is ok, for such rate we expected much better service and breakfast

review.title: Convinient location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Clean and in a convinient location. You can walk to many attraccions

review.title: Noisy overpriced motel.
review.reviewText: For the amount of money, I paid, I would have expected conditions to be somewhat as close to Holiday Inn level as possible. I paid a fee greater than it should have been, for one night, and half would have been okay for this place. I would not book here again and as a travel agent, I would not recommend this place to my clients. As I said before, half would have been okay. I do want to add that this place in not terrible, the staff was great but okay is the best rating I can give this place.
review.negativeRemarks: The place is very noisy and parking is limited. For what is charged, the place could use remodeling and sound proofing.
review.locationRemarks: Location was okay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We booked a last minute room in San Francisco and wanted to be near popular attractions.  For the price, in comparison to other hotels, this was a great deal.  Although it needed several updates, it was clean and in a great location.  It was within walking distance to fisherman's wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location so you could leave the car and walk to popular destinations.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the hotel and clean up the parking lot.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to fisherman's wharf and the world's crookedest street.

review.title: Good location Retro Motel
review.reviewText: Nice spot friendly staff. Close to everything which is very helpful considering traffic in San Francisco. Room was small. Had a great view. Bathroom was big. Elevator was cool with view of street as you went up. Parking is very tight. Tough spot for large cars or trucks. My family and I spend three nights there and would stay again.

review.title: Special place<3
review.reviewText: the francisco bay in has always been a very special place for my boyfriend and I -it is basically were we first met abt.2 years ago now, and we have spent many romantic nights in the comfort of the cozy ,clean and respected rooms @FNI.... Local shopping and dining and proximity to the marina as well as the palace of fine arts; is ultimate bonus rounding off this motels very SF ambiance!

review.title: Free parking and great location! But noisy
review.reviewText: Free parking in a really great, walkable area of the city! That's the best selling point really - and it really was a great location for walking to Fisherman's wharf and the whole Pier 39 area and it was easy to uber around if you didn't want to have to find parking elsewhere. However, either the walls are very thin or people are really loud in this area. We woke up during the nights a couple times from loud traffic and people yelling. You know it's rough when they leave you earplugs as a welcome gift ;) but it was still tolerable as long as you're aware of it and the place was clean and very convenient! Still would recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: noise - although might take a rebuild of the walls to really fix that!
review.locationRemarks: fisherman's wharf, ghiradelli square, pier 39. we even walked all the way to the financial district and lombard street but it's a lot of steps!

review.title: Good value!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, main 'tourist attractions' within walking distance and free car parking would definitely bring me back here in future. Room was clean and comfortable although the mattress was definitely past its best.

review.title: good for 1 night
review.reviewText: Noisy area but relatively close to Pier. Good place to stay for a night.

review.title: hotel close to sites
review.reviewText: Hotel was close to sites. High cost for ammenities.

review.title: Nice place in a convenient location
review.reviewText: Only about one mile from Fisherman's Wharf and The Embarcadero. Easy to walk to where all the action is. Beautiful views all around. From the 4th floor the Golden Gate Bridge is often visible. Free parking makes it a great value. I'd definitely stay here again if there is a room available when I'm in San Francisco again.

review.title: Terrible parking,  worst continental breakfast,
review.reviewText: Few parking slots, have to double park, leave keys with hotel staff,  worst continental breakfast, stale donuts and bad tasting coffee , rooms are old, staff was.great,  worth what you pay for

review.title: Great location and parking.
review.reviewText: We got a good night's sleep.  Room and bathroom were comfortable and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: More towels.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: plenty of noise
review.reviewText: The hotel was very noisy. Sound proof Windows wood be a good addition. Parking was good and the neighborhood was good.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: I've stayed here several times. Great amenities with free parking and wifi. Breakfast is lacking but I was in the city for a meeting that was serving breakfast anyway. No frills but the rooms are clean and the location is good.

review.title: nice staff/clean rooms
review.reviewText: Amy at the front desk is really nice and helpful! Rooms are clean, but the noise from outside is a little on the loud side, and third floor guest can be heard "stomping". Over all, we were happy with the accommodations!
Close to Bus routes for the Golden Gate Bridge Really very central at a reasonable price

review.title: Hotel is close to town.
review.reviewText: The hotel is old.  Parking lot is small.  Come back late would have trouble finding a parking space.  Hotel located in a busy street (Lombard Street), so it can be noisy in the morning. Everything else was really good.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs an upgrade, especially carpet.
review.locationRemarks: Good location for us.  Midway between downtown and lands end.

review.title: nice hotel great staff
review.reviewText: nice hotel staff very accommodating always ready to help, room very well equipped and clean and comfortable  although a little dated, I would certainly stay here again
review.negativeRemarks: a little updating
review.locationRemarks: a 10 - 15 min walk to Fisherman's wharf

review.title: Close to the city activities
review.reviewText:
Easy to find. Greated warmly.  Gave you hear plugs for street noise.
Everything worked - heater, TV, Frig,.  
Comfortable bed.
Parking was tight.
review.positiveRemarks: For being an older hotel our room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was free but very limited.  However, expected in San Francisico.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisico site seeing, Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's Warf etc....

review.title: Best deal
review.reviewText: This hotel was average. It was the best deal icy our looking for an affordable room with no extra charge for parking and wifi.

review.title: Great price. Free parking.
review.reviewText: Coffee pot refrigerator And microwave in room close to fishermans wharf with free parking. I recommend leaving car in parking lot and walking or taking public transportation to wharf and saving $$

review.title: Nice was good
review.reviewText: For SFO was wonderful and the hotel have good location.

review.title: Close to it all
review.reviewText: Price was great for location was close to all the sites and food near by.

review.title: Loud street
review.reviewText: This motel is old and definitely not a vacation destination place to stay. Rooms very small and outdated. Bathroom floor sticky. Breakfast is a couple of pastries and instant coffee. Could not recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Update rooms. Cleanliness. Advertise for what it is.
review.locationRemarks: Lots to do. Museums, beach, zoo, pier 39.

review.title: Nice Hotel near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Good position & walking distance to tram.  Close to Fisherman's Wharf.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean Hotel, plenty of room, good size bathroom, lift to 1st floor.
review.negativeRemarks: fruit with breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance Fisherman's Wharf, "hop on hop off" bus tours, delicious Ghirardelli Chocolate cafe, Alcatraz Island tour, Seafood Chowder eateries

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel but it's clean & close to locations. You can walk to some locations but if you're too tired or lazy, you can take the uber ride & it's cheap cause it's close. A little problem about parking but staff took care of it. For the price I paid w/ own bathroom... The cheapest I could find. Will come back & recommend. Satisfied customer!!!ðŸ˜Š

review.title: Nice hotel close to public transit
review.reviewText: The location was great. It was near public transit. One bus took us to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Never had a problem with hot water when taking a shower. There were muffins, donuts, pastries for us in the early morning. Coffee, hot chocolate and tea were served throughout the day in the office. We had a coffee maker, microwave, mini refrigerator, large flat screen TV, free wifi, hair dryer, and iron and ironing board in the room. There is off street parking for customers.  I would come back here again.
review.locationRemarks: Lombard Street - the crookest street in San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf (odd number piers), Marina, Palace of the Arts, Coit Tower, Chinatown

review.title: Wonderfully appointed hotel; Close to attractions
review.reviewText: This wonderfully, quaint hotel with special appointments, that is, all the amenities needed while away from home was delightful.  Rooms were particularly clean and equipped with shampoo,  conditioner, quality bath soap, lotion, tea bags, coffee maker, hair dryer,  mints, iron board, and even ear plugs. Yes you guessed it right...the main street (Lombard) was noisy at around 7 am week days therefore the ear plugs drowned out the sound. Evenings and early morning hours were pleasantly quiet. The General Manager was personable and friendly while other staff were equally polite and helpful. Rooms were fairly priced and the room were large. This hotel is tops on my list and I definitely plan on going back.

review.title: Save money for parking, hard bed
review.reviewText: This is working class hotel. It was very clean and the staff aimed to please.  The towels were very thin and the bed was hard.  There was only instant coffee served in the lounge but the coffee in the room was good.  The area was safe to walk in and we found a great restaurant within walking distance.  We wish the room had even a very small table or desk. There was no place to set the laptop.  The bathroom was very large and the shower was full sized.  No closets however.  If you don't mind the hard bed this hotel will save you money.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, free parking, safe to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: Softer beds, thicker towels, a desk or table in the room.  Also, one elevator was out of order.
review.locationRemarks: Dining.

review.title: DONT GO HERE
review.reviewText: Somebody on the staff stole my watch that was not in the open. When I discussed with management they did not care. They were not helpful and they treated me poorly the rest of my stay. DO NOT COME HERE.

review.title: Clean room, wrong night!
review.reviewText:
The tiny room I stayed in was nice looking and clean. Lots of lights, TV, the bathroom was small and hard to get out of (inward turning door) but was basically spotless. The breakfast consists of instant coffee, tea, pastries.

This would have been a comfortable stay had there not been problems with the people around us. There was an issue next door. Front desk was called and it seemed to be taken care of.
Early in the morning-- around 2am---a man lightly knocked at our door and left. This happened over 3 times. Front desk was called and seemed unsure what to do. I got 3 hours of half-awake, on-guard sleep that night.

review.title: It was nice.
review.reviewText: It was nice.the hotel exceeded my needs. I wanted rest, cleanliness, and quite frankly I received just that.

review.title: Within walking distance to the finest seafood
review.reviewText: Hotel staff polite & friendly & very helpful......air conditioner was too noisy, mould on the bathroom ceiling was not appealingly.

review.title: Great location at a reasonable price.
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything. You can even walk to the fisherman's wharf, pier 39, ghirardelli chocolate factory, and a lot more nice places if you don't mind walking which is just about 1.4 miles away from this hotel. If you will take the Big Bus city tour, it's just a few steps away where the bus stops. My experience with my family from this hotel would have been excellent if not for the other guests without a conscience who opens their car doors not minding the other cars beside them. My car was parked properly but this big white Chevy suv left a big dent on my car. I should have checked my car before leaving. I only noticed it on our first stop to put gas.
review.positiveRemarks: First is the location, second is the free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: The clothes hanger in our room was placed just about 12 inches above the microwave. You don't want your clothes to smell food.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is a walking distance to the famous crookedest Lombard street. There are many restaurants nearby and very safe to walk around even at night

review.title: You get what u pay for
review.reviewText: Ok hotel if you don't plan on spending a lot of time there. If you are used to holiday inn express or comfort inn then this hotel is more like super 8. It smelled like pee really bad, dirty carpets,lamps didn't turn on and only one person spoke English but couldn't help with anything because she wasn't local!

review.title: Good location & friendly staff
review.reviewText: We enjoyed staying here the room was always clean and the staff are very helpful in assisting in recommending things to do while staying in San Francisco

review.title: Central hotel
review.reviewText: Honest budget near to all key areas within easy reach of Polk which offers excellent eating .
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms a little dated . Top floor rooms as it can be noisy
review.locationRemarks: Central to all.

review.title: Great Location,  Priced Right
review.reviewText:
Great location. Felt very safe walking around at night. Walked to the Beauna Vista Caffee which has AMAZING Irish Coffee and of course Lombard street and the whalf. The distances are short, but the hills give you a workout.

Staying in the Tenderloin is cheaper, but does not always feel safe...

review.title: NEEDS UPGRADE.
review.reviewText:
Is not the hotel's fault. But if you have kids try to find something else. People were smoking weed around there. 
And it does need a little upgrade for rhe price.

review.title: The hotel is close to Golden Gate Bridge.
review.reviewText:
Check in fast I like the breakfast coffee available all night room very clean and nice 
I like is very close to fishermen market .

review.title: Very clean and kept up rooms. Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel room was nice for the price. Beds were comfy and everything was clean. The staff were very nice and took care of us well. The location was close to most attractions which we walked most of the time. I would stay here again and recommend my friends and family to also.

review.title: Hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The room generally appeared clean but my bathroom floor showed evidence of the previous guest in the form of mysterious hairs and dust. Luckily the bathroom was cleaned proerly when the room was serviced. Great location and surprisingly quiet.

review.title: Great location for what we needed to do in SF.
review.reviewText: Nice staff, very clean room, perfect location for the purpose of the visit.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed. That's the only fault I can find with this place.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to. Lot's of great reasonable restaurants. Wonderful shops in a quiet neighborhood.

review.title: Convinient and affordable
review.reviewText: I stayed here for two days on the weekend after Thanksgiving. The room was very clean and spacious, and the staff was polite. The parking was full, but I found parking in the surrounding neighborhood (free and all day on the weekends).

review.title: Staff was fantastic
review.reviewText: Great trip! Great location, willing to answer all of our questions! Helped with cabs, directions, outings, and any other issues we had.

review.title: Nice hotel & good location.
review.reviewText: Check in was quick. Staff were friendly & helpful. Room was clean & tidy & bed was very comfortable. Location is good with transport & hop on & of bus stop nearby, which can take you to the fishermans wharf, Chinatown, & union st .Breakfast was basic but nice. I would stay here again & would recommend it to my friends

review.title: Please read before you book.
review.reviewText: First off, when we arrived at the motel we had to wait fifteen minutes to be let into lobby because the woman was not in and the door was locked. When we got in, there was no apology for the wait or any greeting whatsoever. She promptly says that they were overbooked and were moved about .5 a mile down the road to their sister site. When using Expedia I did not expect to be staying at the Inn on Broadway instead of Francisco Bay Inn we had booked. That was extremely frustrating considering we had luggage and were on foot. Not a good start to say the least. When we arrived at the sister site motel, the smell of mildew and cleaner was over powering. We had to turn on the a/c full blast to drown it out although it was cold inside already. The sheets did seem clean but the bathroom had hair through the sink and tub which is disgusting. For a night out in the city when everything else is booked I figured we had no other options as we were just using it to sleep. I would never recommend nor stay there again. I am very disappointed with Expedia for the bait and switch with no notice or better option as well. I will be trying to get a refund.

review.title: Friendly and caring staff
review.reviewText: Very nice clean room, front desk very nice and caring, did a few things I didn't even ask for (such as checking on my shuttle several times). Tea and pastries in the lobby.

review.title: excellent hotel . the staff was all very kimd
review.reviewText:
everything was amazingggggg
the staff answer well all we ask
the rooms clean and good smell
the super convenient breakfast
review.negativeRemarks: maybe more parking spaces and change the battoob for showers
review.locationRemarks: the best the best the best

review.title: Nice hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The room was clean. The staff was nice and friendly. I was told there was going to be croissants and coffee for breakfast. They only had donuts and instant coffee. I ended up not drinking the coffee and stopping at Starbucks on the way home. I was happy that they had supplied earplugs however as my first floor room was noisy. The bed was very comfortable. Overall I was happy and would recommend the hotel.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: For the price and location, I would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of restaurants in walking distance. $10 cab ride to bars and clubs.

review.title: Good Distance to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
Cheap and cheerful. Reception staff very accommodating of our questions and requests.
15 min walk to Fisherman's wharf or 10-15 buck taxi ride home after a long day out seeing the sights and sampling the beers. 
If you are planning on spending a lot of time in your room then you would want somewhere more upmarket but Francisco Bay Inn was great for our needs. Clean, easy and in a good location for somewhere to lay your head at the end of busy days (and nights) in San Francisco.

review.title: A great surprise...
review.reviewText: What a great surprise. 1st, free parking. Save yourself $30 a day right there! 2nd, booked a single queen, got a double. Clean, quaint, old school, but safe and larger than the expected. It in in a bar area and we were there for Halloween weekend and did not notice at all! Slept through the night without a peep. Stay here and save your money for SF. You will need it!

review.title: DISAPPOINTED IN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText: HOTEL HAS A GREAT LOCATION, CLOSE TO FISHERMAN'S WHARF.  A "BIG BUS" STOP IS JUST A BLOCK AWAY.  HOTEL IS LOCATED ON LOMBARD STREET, THAT HAS TRAFFIC GOING TO AND COMING FROM THE GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE, THERFORE IT IS VERY NOISY.  WE SHOULD HAVE NOTICED SOMETHING WHEN SETS OF EAR PLUGS ARE PART OF THE ROOM'S AMENITIES.  PLACES TO EAT ARE FROM A BLOCK TO SIX BLOCKS AWAY.
review.negativeRemarks: NOISE QUIETING.  DECENT BED.  A REAL CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST, NOT JUST A ALMOST STALE DONUT.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Okay Hotel, on the old side but clean. Good price for San Fran
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Warf 20 Min walk
review.locationRemarks: Close to Fisherman's Warf about a 20 Minute walk

review.title: OK for the price
review.reviewText: The stay was ok about your Motel 6 standards. Ear plugs are necessary or you can drown out noise with AC. The room above us was very very noisy worse than Lombard street traffic. You could hear the floors creaking loudly & every footstep above us. This was the most annoying.

review.title: Nice location except for the traffic noise
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't as nice as I expected. No extras, not even a dresser. It was very noisy with car traffic even in the middle of the night. The staff told me they would put us in a "quiet" room. I can't imagine what a noisy room would be. Good location if you don't mind walking. We walked almost everywhere. Most tourist sites within a couple miles. Staff was friendly. Continental breakfast was donuts so a little disappointed there too. Overall the room was fine, especially since we weren't there much.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, served it's purpose, and friendly staff. Also free parking (we had a rental car that we only used once).
review.negativeRemarks: Improved breakfast. Continental still means more than donuts to me. A dresser would have been nice.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good if you don't mind walking. We put on 7-9 miles a day and saw LOTS of tourist things. So much to do!

review.reviewText: Comfortable, semi- close to Fishermans Wharf, bathroom was clean and big, bed was comfortable, room a little small. But the traffic made it hard to have a good nights sleep, it's close to a very busy street. ( motel provided ear plugs)

review.title: Nice hotel, big room, immense bathroom
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel, price was reasonable for the value, comfortable bed, good location, 13 min walk to fishermen's wharf, nice staff.
Elevator is available in the hotel premises.

review.title: Simple but well located and nice
review.reviewText:
My wife and I just returned from only a couple of vacations days in Frisco and were looking for a well located hotel at a reasonable price range, that would be mainly used for sleeping (since we planned to be out most of the time). The first impression of the Francisco Bay Inn was not the best. From the outside it looked like a cheap,  run-down,  road-side motel, but our impression changed in the minute we registered at the front desk since the reception was very welcoming and warming.  The room itself was well sized, clean, with TV, refrigerator, AC but without any special amenities or charm. The breakfast was a tray of doughnuts, a bottle of hot water and a can of instant coffee placed on a small table at the reception. Not fancy at all but not bad either, if you do not mind eating on-the-go or taking it to the room. 
All that being said, our stay was uneventful. The location was very good, walking distance (if you like to walk) to restaurants, bars and the wharf region. And with a distant view of the Golden Brigde.
We recommend the hotel to anyone that is not looking for luxury or spending much time in the hotel. 
Hope that helps!
review.positiveRemarks: clean room, friendly staff and well-located.
review.negativeRemarks: better maintenance of the common areas.

review.reviewText: Very clean, nice motel-- you can smell the ocean from here! So pleased! Pleasant area as well.

review.title: Two night stay
review.reviewText: Family of four. Location is close to everything just a short walk. Motel was clean and beds good. Continental breakfast was donuts and pastries. Staff are friendly. We stayed two nights.

review.title: It's a Motel
review.reviewText:
Pictures look nice, however it is a motel and appears all places on Lombard street are similar.  Very noisy... and to compensate, you get free ear plugs on your night stand.  Lots of road noise on this busy street.  Delivery trucks like to beep their horns at 5AM.

Staff are great people and they put out free pastries in the morning.
Overbooked and got a call, left no return phone # moving me to another inn.  Carpet was dirty, thin walls. Breakfast was absolute minimum.

review.title: Overpriced but good location
review.reviewText: The room was very small, dated and a bit smelly. But the location was good, close to bike hire on Lombard street and walking distance from Chestnut street. Staff at reception was very helpful. Breakfast was included, but as donuts and tea/coffee made available at reception, i.e. not a seated breakfast as we were expecting.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff at reception was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are dated and small. Overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Good location on Lombard street.

review.title: Close to the top tourist destinations
review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located near tourist spots and many restaurants. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I would recommend a back facing room to help with some of the street noise. Earplugs are provided if needed. The 47 bus is one block north, where one can travel to the wharf area and south toward town and restaurants. The 3 day Muni pass was a perfect way to travel around town.

review.title: They not have available the room I search
review.reviewText: Terrible breakfast only sweet bread and coffee And the add twin bed in my room instead 2 queen bed and very small room

review.title: Nice location and quiet room
review.reviewText: i asked for a quiet room and they put us in the back. It can be noisy in the front since its right off a busy street. Walking distance from fishermans warf and the marina beach. Room was nice. Its a bit pricey for the quality but i guess you pay for the great location

review.title: Nice place close to main tourist places
review.reviewText: It was nice but very expensive experience. SFO is gorgeous.

review.title: Overall a decent hotel near everything
review.reviewText: The hotel room is about on par with a Marriott or Embassy, the bathroom is very large.  The staff is super friendly and accommodating, they have free parking and they will make sure you have a parking space.  The room was very clean and it seems that from the front desk to the maids they really go out of their way to make sure you are happy.  Other reviews show breakfast as "interesting", "not much", it is donuts, instant coffee, powdered cocoa mix and a big decanter of hot water. Beyond that the location is great for walking to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was great and the room was quiet.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to the Fisherman's Wharf, and Ghirardelli square.

review.title: Within walking to Marina / Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: Last minute, Saturday night booking for one night. Free parking a plus! Room with king size bed was clean but very small and a bit outdated. Bathroom was large and clean. Walls are thin so lots noise heard from other rooms. Complimentary breakfast was very limited. Staff were helpful in providing an extra towel, and access to printer to print out boarding passes.
review.negativeRemarks: Update decor, more comfortable beds, better complimentary breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf. Union St. restaurants

review.reviewText: Did not have room we reserved. Had to settle for different bed set up or would need to go to different sister hotel

review.title: nice comfortable simple
review.reviewText: No frills, and that was just fine. I felt safe and comfortable after 2 awful hotel experiences the day before. So if you just want simple,clean, and comfortable, this is the place!

review.title: Conveniently located but way overpriced
review.reviewText: This hotel provides no amenities besides a bed in a bathroom. For the same exact price one can do ten times better. I would not recommend this unless you are a single traveller just looking for a flophouse

review.title: OK room
review.reviewText: We needed a room in San Francisco on short notice and found this one. The location was good and parking was free (but first come, first served). The hotel was old and a little threadbare but clean and safe. The breakfast was ho-hum and had to be taken back to the room. The front desk staff was helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Spruce up the rooms with new bedding and either paint or new wallpaper
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is within a mile and a half of the Wharf and all the attractions there - a pretty easy walk.

review.title: Good location, free parking, OK room
review.reviewText: Good location.  (Long) walking distance to Ghiradelli Square and Fisherman's Wharf.  Free parking, compared to other hotels we saw along the way that were charging $40/night for parking.  Room was ok.  On the small side.  Bathroom was large.  Noisy with lots of street noise.  Air conditioning was nice and cool.  Hardly any outlets - had to plug our charger into the plug on the back of the microwave and the computer in the outlet across the room from the desk on the side of the bed.  Have stayed here before and would stay here again for the location and the free parking.
review.negativeRemarks: More outlets for plugging things in.  Updated bedding and carpeting.
review.locationRemarks: Chestnut Diner on Chestnut street for breakfast.  Mel's Drive Inn for lunch/dinner.  Ghiradelli Square. Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Nice hotel located near fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: Hotel 20 min. Walk to Fishermans Wharf. 7 blocks away from the crooked street and 40 min. Walk to California street to catch a cable car

review.title: Nice hotel, very convenient
review.reviewText: We lived in San Francisco many years ago when I was in the Army.  It was fun going back to some of the places that we enjoyed when we were much younger.  Did not have to cope with the crowds years ago but it was a different story this time.  We would have visited Alcatraz but were unable to get tickets.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is always a problem and the elevators are pretty old.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many SF attractions.

review.title: Good spot
review.reviewText: Centrally located and good access to both driving destinations and use of public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient location; parking on site; friendly personnel

review.title: The hotel has a great location.
review.reviewText: Great location and you can catch the hop on hop off bus just outside the door. The beds are very comfortable and it is clean. The breakfast is interesting. The staff are helpful.

review.title: More than expected!!
review.reviewText: I arrived early at around 430pm and checked in. It was an easy check and got lucky because there were plenty of parking spots left. They are first come first serve. Room was a lot nicer than I expected. Awesome comfy king bed, flat screen tv, fridge and microwave. Restroom was huge. We stayed facing Lombard street and thought it would be noisy but we slept with ac on and could not hear a thing. Baby and wife slept through the night!! Stroll to fishermans wharf was about 20min. All and all More than I expected since I only paid $150. Will return again.

review.title: great hotel for location and price
review.reviewText: After reading tons of reviews and switching hotels twice because of scary input, we chose this for our weekend in SF.  I was pleasantly surprised by our room, it was clean and cozy with a sizable bathroom.  We arrived early and the front desk clerk allowed us to park for free and told us to begin our vacation and enjoy ourselves.  The hotel is within walking distance of the wharf and many tourist attractions as well as many bus stops to get you where you need to go.  The front desk was helpful in pointing us in the direction we needed to go.  The room was quiet despite being on a busy street and within a block of a coffee shop for mornings.  Only complaint was the pillows were flat and hard.

review.title: In walking distance to alot!!

Staff were friendly and knowledgeable about surrounding area and helpful with "must see" recommendations.  Room was small but clean and everything worked properly.  We were in walking distance to the The Pier, Ghirardellies, Trolley start/end point, Crooked Street, restaurants and the tour bus stop was just down street.  Parking lot was small but the hotel figured out how to accommodate everyone to avoid added public parking fees.  We would definitely stay here again!

review.title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in, avoid
review.reviewText: I tend to give most hotels a 4 or a 5, but this hotel is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was disgustingly dirty, the TV was digital which meant I couldn't get a signal on any channels, the wifi was broken, I left my room at 8am and when I returned at 5pm the room still hadn't been cleaned, the cleaners said it was one of the last rooms on there root and would be cleaned at 7pm. The road this hotel is located on is one of the busiest roads in San Francisco with lorrys and traffic all night long. Usually this wouldn't be an issue in a decent hotel but the windows were as thin as PVC so you heard everything I got absolutely no sleep whatsoever. The final nail in the coffin as mentioned in the prior reviews is the breakfast. It is left in the reception area which is the size of a toilet you can only enter one at a time, so in the morning the queue for breakfast was about an hour. Once you finally get in as the room is tiny the food always runs out. I arrived at 8am and the milk and cereal had finished. The only choice for breakfast is cheerios or brown bread I am not joking. Because the room is only big enough for one and there is no table you have to take whatever breakfast you can find to your room. I would rate this hotel zero if I could, avoid at all costs.

review.reviewText: I came to this hotel to stay the night in the city after picking up my girlfriend from the airport. It was a great experience with very friendly desk clerks that helped out with any questions we had. One clerk helped me find and order food to the hotel using his computer. The parking lot was quite tight in the parking lot so I would not suggest it for very large vehicles unless you check in very early right after 3 pm. The hotel itself was sort of old fashioned which was cute. The only complaint I really had was about the temperature of the shower which fluctuated from hot to cold alot. Next time I am in the city I plan to stay here again!!

review.title: Nice hotel! Well worth the money - close to a lot!
review.reviewText:
First off, I think anyone who has never been to San Francisco and rates this hotel as "too loud with street traffic" should not be counted, LOL!  Of course staying on Lombard St. you're going to have some noise from the street. That should be expected. The hotel is nice enough to provide ear plugs right by your bedside for those that need them!  I've stayed at many hotels in SF on Lombard and other busy streets and have never had any provide us ear plugs!  We didn't need them, as the noise is not THAT bad (and our hotel room was facing the street). You get used to it, or maybe I just expected it!
The free parking is another great feature of this hotel.  It's hard to find decent hotels with parking included. Normally they charge $30-$50+/night.  We arrived on a Sat night, around 6pm, and their lot was full, with the exception of one small spot. We have a pretty large SUV and it was a very tight fit. When I asked if they had another lot, the lady at the front desk was very accommodating and offered for us to park in the lined spot next to the hanicapped spot.  That worked out perfectly!
The front desk staff, both evening and mornings, were very polite and helpful. 
Their breakfast included in the morning was more than I expected. Normally when hotels advertise "breakfast included", it means you get your choice of a packaged pastry and coffee/OJ.  Francisco Bay Inn had a large variety, including muffins, toast, oatmeal, donuts, English muffins, etc..!  
I HIGHLY recommend them!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Clean,,comfortable, easy access to everything. Friendly staff.  Good beds. U will need the ear plugs that are provided for the road noise.

review.title: Good value for your money
review.reviewText: Great location, very friendly and helpful stuff. rooms are quite old fashioned, but comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: clearly, location is a great additional to this hotel

review.reviewText: The room was on sale!! still way to much for a roadside motel! definately not a Hotel!!
Good location.  Good price.  The value of the room for the price is good.  If you want luxury, then you would need to pay much higher rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleaning service came as late as 5:45 in the evening.
review.locationRemarks: Marina neighborhood, fisherman's wharf, shopping.  Very good location.

review.title: Road noise
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is good. Price look reasonable. But the rooms are too noisy because of bad isolation. Considering the small size rooms, old utilities and the noise; I think this hotel doesn't worth $100.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Is not luxurious at all, but it's clean. A little bit noisy, and the carpet was really old, but as I said before it was clean. Location was good close to the main attractions. Hop in hop off tours only one block to the hotel!

review.title: Nice location, free parking!
review.reviewText:
We booked this hotel at 5pm the night of our stay. We were able to get a great rate on the room, however our room (#100) was DIRECTLY next to the road. The hotel even provided earplugs. The noise must be a common complaint. However, I did not have any issue at all. Once the blinds were closed and air conditioning was on, I didn't hear too much noise.
Other than that, the hotel room was very clean and spacious. Hotel staff very friendly. Nice continental breakfast (except a big booooo to the instant coffee, yuck). 
Would recommend for 1 or 2 nights max.
review.negativeRemarks: Real coffee at breakfast!

review.title: I would never stay here again.
review.reviewText: Electrical fixtures didn't work. Shower head set very low, with minimal to no hot water. Paper thin walls made for a very noisy experience, which is why they generously provide earplugs with the room. "Continental Breakfast" includes hot water for your powdered coffee, with some old apples and packaged pastries. Overall, very disappointing for the $$$.

The maid service were unable to speak English making it impossible to communicate with them. They also came late in the day. They elevator and the stair way was always unclean. Roberta was awesome. Very helpful in our trip. We appreciated him very much. The hotel has inadequate parking for the number of rooms. If two of the spots were not leased out it would making it a bit easier to park. Also only one handicap parking.
review.negativeRemarks: maid service
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39, Union Street. Close to most things that we wanted to walk to.

review.title: Pictures are fake
review.reviewText:
Before you book this hotel, check the review on yelp

Stayed here with my family, one two queen bed room and one king bed room. When I am checking in, I asked the worker here if they really has bed bug problem and I am 100% sure this guy lied to me. He said he had been working here for several months and never heard of the bed bugs problem. However he could not look at me in the eye when he is answering. Charged 25 deposit for each room. The parking space is not enough so we have to double park. I felt unsafe giving my car key to a inn but had no choice. The room was ok and I didn't have beg bug problem but I can tell you they don't change the sheets! I placed a bed bug catcher under the sheet and when I came back the catcher was still in the same place. The wi-fi is horrible = no wifi at all. (Maybe because my room is on the 4th floor) the breakfast was ok, nothing too special. Old tv and the air conditioner just can't get the right temperature. For the queen bedroom, the ac was right next to bed. No one can sleep with an ac right next to them. It looks like the king room has not been used for a week or so because there are a lot of dust on the coffee machine and coffee bags. The maid did not even bother to clean them.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: This hotel room did not look like the pictures on the internet. It was not as clean as I thought it would be. The room smelt like bleach or feet couldn't tell which one. There was hair on my towel which was not the color of my wife's hair or mine. There was no sign to let the staff know you did not want to be disturbed. When I packed my car to leave I noticed I wad being blocked in by another car parked behind me. It turned out to be someone who worked in the dental office next store. The only good thing was one of the staff memebrs named Antonio. He wad very helpful with directions around the city and wanted to know how our stay was. Very frendly guy. I would not stay here again.

review.title: Inn not great but had awesome location & parking
review.reviewText: The inn wasn't great and the staff was kind of rude. But I didn't really care because the location was awesome and parking was included. Included parking is a big perk in sf.

review.title: Good budget hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable at a reasonable price. Easy to find right off the highway. The hotel is about 10 minutes from San Francisco International Airport.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast buffet was good. Included Waffles, scrambled eggs, and sausages as well as the standard items most buffets have. Good wi-fi connection.
review.negativeRemarks: Security. My first impression when checking inn was a guy at the reception reporting his laptop had been stolen from his room.

review.title: Not bad.
review.reviewText: Have stayed there twice and for accommodation on a budget it's not too bad.
Stripped down but great location. Very outdated decor

review.title: I enjoyed the hotel room and good size bathroom
review.reviewText: I liked the room which was clean and spacious for being on Lombard st. I will stay there again

review.title: Comfortable hotel close to main tourist highlights
review.reviewText: Generally good value and met our expectations. Only disappointment was the breakfast provided - little choice, tepid coffee, no space to eat in other than hiking back to your room.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast - as noted. More parking spaces.
review.locationRemarks: An easy walk to the S F waterfront area, cable cars, cycle hire outlets, shopping. On the route for hop on hop off bus tours.

review.reviewText: Nice staff great value little crowded in the parking lot, but no complaints

review.title: Will not stay here
review.reviewText: After waiting 15 mins to be checked in, was told that the carpets in our room had been flooded and it was the last available room. So they had booked a room for us at a partner hotel. No courtesy call to let us know of the situation beforehand.

review.title: Hotel close to fisherman wharft
review.reviewText: Clean, nice hotel, on busy street but noise was not to bad. Close to bus stop to downtown or if one does not mind walking not to far to walk to fisherman wharft. Free parking easy in and out so if one wanted to use car during the day it was not a problem to access car. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy parking, close to fisher mans wharft
review.negativeRemarks: Better Wifi
review.locationRemarks: Easy to catch bus to down town, or GOlden Gate Bridge, short steep uphill walk to cable car stop

review.title: good hotel on major street,
review.reviewText: over all it's not bad, service was good, just a few things, TVs are still old Standard Def (I hate it), Fridge is too close to bed, can't sleep with fridge sound,
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom/shower was big, nice and clean, continental breakfast included
review.negativeRemarks: replace all TVs, replace the carpet, fix the elevator (make it nice), change the fridge place to another side of the room
review.locationRemarks: some restaurants close by, about 40min walking distance to fisherman's wharf

review.title: Nice and clean
review.reviewText: It closed to the pier, free parking + very good location !

review.title: Small room with horrible parking
review.reviewText: Room was very tiny and cramped. 2nd night we were there maid didnt show up until 5 in the afternoon. Worst part was the parking. Motel employees and employees from dental office next door would take guests parking spots or would park behind cars so you would have to go to office to ask for cars to be moved to get out.

review.title: Close to fisherman's wharf and China town.
review.reviewText: Good restaurants all around the hotel. Walking distance to China Town and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Decent hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Family had a great stay in this hotel. It's not very cheap but because the location was great, it was OK.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Free parking, wi-fi, & breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Electrical plugs were not located near the desk. Had to unplug other appliances to be able to use them. Parking was challenging if you get in late.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf is walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel close to bus stops
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with free parking and pleasant staff. Only problem was poor internet connection.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet.
review.locationRemarks: Reasonable location not in the main downtown area, but close to bus stops.

review.title: Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: Did not look like pics on website. Hotel room was small and had hotel smell. Noisy - did not get good rest that night.

review.title: Very nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
Free parking but the parking is very small.
If you park behind someone else's car you have to leave your car key at the front desk so they can move your car if they need to. You may get blocked by another car and you have to wait for the front desk person to move the car so you can get out. There is only one person at the front desk so this can take a while.
Very clean and spacious room for the price.

review.title: Reasonable
review.reviewText: The experience was one that can be described as "Reasonable" the room was satisfactory, the parking availability was ok if you drive a smaller vehicle, the on-line listing stated breakfast was included but what was available had to be consumed in the parking lot or taken back to the room,
review.positiveRemarks: the location, room accesability in respect to parking, the character of the building. Friendly staff.

review.title: Hotel by the bay.
review.reviewText:
It was a nice hotel. Friendly staff, nice big clean bathroom and room. Only complaint room was
cold.

review.title: Close to Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: The beds are very tiny vant even fit two comfortable. No HBO like advertised. The breakfast is a joke! WAY over priced! And couldnt get my $100.00 deposit back until I let some one come in and search room. Also had drug dealer solicit me and my children at 10:30 at night, KNOCKED ON MY DOOR!!!!

review.title: Very clean is good if the price is right
review.reviewText: Average, they still have tube TVs that kept staticing but the staff is very nice and go out of their way to accommodate you.

review.title: nice personal
review.reviewText: Way too much mony for such an old hotel more like a motel 6 we wont be staying there again.

review.title: Clean and close to everything. parking is free.
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and clean but the walls are so thin that you could hear voice from outside. They provide earplugs and we didn't use it coz the noise from the street which the cars passing by are tolerable but not with this one,around 2:30 am, people arrived here and probably they just came from the club. They hang out by the hallway next to the stairs and our room is just next to it. It was so terrible, they were dancing and singing and sounds and feels like they were inside our room. It was so loud,I could hear clearly what they are talking about. So I called the front desk right away. Everything should be OK except with this experience.

review.title: Really noisy hotel
review.reviewText: Booked two nights had to cancel second night. Uncomfortable bed and extremely noisy hotel

review.title: Nice and cheap in an expensive city
review.reviewText: Just what we were looking for to save money for eating out and sightseeing. Friendly and helpful staff. Only complaints are thin walls and steep hills away from city attractions however for the price it was perfect.

review.title: Very noisy rooms! Otherwise very nice!
review.reviewText:
The first night, we stayed at a ground-floor room, which was horrible! The room itself was very nice and had everything we needed, but we we're hardly able to sleep (eventough we used earplugs!), we had very noisy neighbours and we heard the traffic very, very loud!
At the next day, the lady at the recpetion was nice enough to give us another room which was located at the 4th floor. Here it was much better, I still slept with the complimentary earplugs, but it was okay. The rooms itself were fine.

review.title: For the cost and location pretty good for SF
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, good location. Served its purpose for a short city trip. Room was a little musty but that's this city.

review.title: The area around the hotel is nice and safe.
review.reviewText: too noisy but clean and tidy. hotel staff are nice. It's easy to move by transit from the hotel because of its location. For the price the hotel is nice and clean. Breakfast is awful but there are lots of places nearby where you can get a nice breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: They should do a better caulking of the doors and windows so the noise from the street is not that loud
review.locationRemarks: easy to move in transit. nice restaurants around. The area is pretty safe

review.title: Very fine for it's price!
review.reviewText: I paid 63/night and it was very bed fine! Better than Powell Hotel which I paid more for less quality!

review.title: Very clean, convenient, great employees, parking g
review.reviewText: Very happy, good experience !
review.negativeRemarks: Heater
review.locationRemarks: Convenient

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText:
Stayed here 2 nights in mid January. PROS: Free parking, good location, free breakfast (donuts, coffee, and fruit), mini fridge and microwave in room, and of course price. I didn't give it a 5 star rating because its not a 5 star hotel.
In response to other reviews: Noise was not an issue (I stayed Tues & Wed. in January) but they did provide earplugs in the room. There was some cosmetic wear n tear noticeable in the room, but it did not ruin my ability to sleep.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone who just wants a place to sleep/shower close to many areas of SF.
review.locationRemarks: Walk to Fisherman's wharf, Union square, a cute neighborhood on Union.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Nice. Clean. Friendly staff. Free parking. Good channels on the tv. Close to everything. Great all in all.

review.title: Convenient!
review.reviewText:
Good Conditions!
Clean and Quiet.
Kind Staff!
Near Attractions!

review.title: Great rate and location.
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel turned out to be perfect for me and two friends sharing a tidy room with two double beds off a quiet alley. It was perfectly located for exploring the tourist attractions, and the local flavor (Polk Street was a highlight). Reasonably priced with a friendly staff, we advise to bring your own toiletries, as the provided are so-so, and not expect to depend on the simple pastries and fruit to get you further than some of the local cafe's (Petit Prince for sure) which are spotted all over.
review.positiveRemarks: The wraparound balconies, welcoming atmosphere, and great locale.
review.negativeRemarks: Get new toilet soaps!
review.locationRemarks: Aato just east up Lombard, Petit Prince down west for breakfast, and then Polk Street for exploring and some sights.

review.title: Down-at-heel motel, not really near anything good
review.reviewText:
The staff are friendly and reception was open late, which was helpful.

The building is a 2-3 storey motel, with external stairs and corridors. There wasn't much security so I wouldn't recommend this to lone travellers. Homeless people had been sitting on the staircase, and people were drinking and smoking further up the staircase.

The blurb for the hotel said that all rooms are newly refurbished, but I didn't think this true to look at the decor and wear-and-tear. The bathroom also smelled really badly (of dog), and the street noise was really loud. It was functional as a budget room, but not very pleasant.

In room facilities were fairly basic - we had a coffee machine and fresh coffee, but no milk or sugar to put in it. The coffee jug lip was also chipped, so coffee went all over the carpet.

Breakfast is a stack of pasties and muffins, fruit and hot coffee. It's in a side room and your help yourself, so all fairly convenient if you're in a hurry.

The location isn't really that great for anywhere for tourists - it's a long walk to the piers or the hipper areas, there isn't much to do in the area. But if you want to be in this area, and don't have much money or high expectations, it would do.
review.positiveRemarks: There are no positives I can really single out.
review.negativeRemarks: Security is my main concern, but also the rooms could be a little more modern and clean.
review.locationRemarks: It seemed to me to be a poor location for tourists in San Francisco.

review.title: Umm..
review.reviewText:
It's a pretty cool hotel, but to be honest for me, the worst thing is that I have to "buy" wifi!!!!
Even we need to pay $10 for 24hr, not during the staying at the hotel. If you need wifi, every 24hr you need to but wifi. I'm staying one more day and I need wifi to get some more infoation to make sure where I should go to enjoy my trip more!! It's not good.

review.title: Good location and Ok for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff is rude when we got the the hotel we were 10 min early for checkin not bad considering we just drove 8 hours to get here, we were sent away and told to come back at the checkin time, so we waited then I went back 5 min after checkin time I was told we would have to wait another 15 to 30 min for the room to be cleaned which was still dirty when we allowed to get to our room. the only thing good about this hotel was the location and price.
review.positiveRemarks: Old, Small rooms our room was dirty and run down.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel staff
review.locationRemarks: Great location easy walking distance to peir 39

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Check in was a little rough. Arrived by 1:45 even though check in was at 2pm..everything was fine until I reached the room and walked into a single king room, when I paid for a standard double room...went back and dragged all my luggage to the front desk....didn't get a room til 2:30pm -___- other than that, it was great for the price! Rooms are okay, nothing fancy but was surprised that room came with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Restroom in room is really large, which was kind of weird. Bathroom soaps and shampoo are really low quality, bring your own. Continental breakfast is provided from 7-9 but get there early cause it runs out fast. Walls are kinda thin, you will hear your neighbors and car alarms, but for the location: walking distance to the wharf and right by the Crokedest st, it's worth it!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Check in was a little rough. Arrived by 1:45 even though check in was at 2pm..everything was fine until I reached the room and walked into a single king room, when I paid for a standard double room...went back and dragged all my luggage to the front desk....didn't get a room til 2:30pm -___- other than that, it was great for the price! Rooms are okay, nothing fancy but was surprised that room came with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker. Restroom in room is really large, which was kind of weird. Bathroom soaps and shampoo are really low quality, bring your own. Continental breakfast is provided from 7-9 but get there early cause it runs out fast. Walls are kinda thin, you will hear your neighbors and car alarms, but for the location: walking distance to the wharf and right by the Crokedest st, it's worth it!

review.title: Convenient and affordable
review.reviewText: Fit nicely with holiday in san francisco

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: I recommend this place is the best. The room is so nice and clean. Nice breakfast and good coffe.

review.title: Great Location and Pricing
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay overall. I have to say, for the price-- the location was perfect. We were really happy to save a few extra dollars on the hotel and instead be able to spend it on shopping and all the good food near by. We enjoyed being able to come and go freely and being so close to main attractions like the pier and the bay. We really encountered no issues except a few minor bumps (the t.v. remote buttons were hard to press and the hair dryer was broken). Other than that, we loved it. The bed was comfy, the water pressure was wonderful, and the view of the golden gate bridge was unreal. I highly suggest this place. Even though at first glance it may seem old and less modern, its awesome. ESPECIALLY FOR STUDENTS OR YOUNG COUPLES. If you need to be constantly pampered and have little chocolates on your pillow for whatever reason, this place isn't for you. However, if you enjoy a homey feel and having a few extra bucks in your pocket. I HIGHLY suggest it.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the view of the golden gate bridge from our balcony, the close walking distance to food and major sites like crookedest street and pier 39.
review.negativeRemarks: Two concerns overall. One- the hair dryer and tv were not in the best shape. Two- the noise, the walls are pretty thin and the doors close loudly.
review.locationRemarks: The location is by far the best part about this hotel. Steps from crookedest street, close to pier 39, ghiradelli chocolate, the bay, and cable cars.

review.title: â˜…â˜… Happyâ˜…â˜…
review.reviewText: It was a great stay:) Nice room great price...The thing that was disappointing was Breakfast;( other then that!! Places to walk to and free parking;)

review.title: Ok stay for the price
review.reviewText: The staff was not the friendliest. One hotel staff had an attitude. The continental breakfast was only pastries, juice, and coffee. Over all it was an ok stay lucky it was only for two nights.

review.title: Great location. Rooms are very small and Crowded.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff. Great Location and free parking is plus.
review.negativeRemarks: Wall papers, tv needs to be changed. restroom door didn't close.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, very safe area

review.title: Great location, nice staff and free parking
review.reviewText: It was a nice clean and great locaiton. we had a nice time
review.locationRemarks: near the pier and cable cars and not to far from shopping

review.title: Free parking was a plus
review.reviewText: Free parking was good. Lots of hotels get $30 a night to park. Breakfast coffee in breakfast room was instant coffee dumped into hot water. We made our own coffee in the room. Breakfast selection was Costco stuff. All carbs.
review.negativeRemarks: Real coffee perked and offered in breakfast room.
review.locationRemarks: Its right on Lombard Street so you walk up 4 blocks and you see the crooked part. The four blocks were quite steep.

review.reviewText: This is a serviceable hotel in a good location. The room was quite small but the bathroom was huge and everything was relatively clean. Worked great when we were in a pinch because United Airlines hates their customers.

review.title: Clean comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: Was a great hotel for the money. Very clean and friendly staff.

review.title: Nice hotel in convenient location
review.reviewText: I was staying by myself and felt safe there. The free parking is a bonus, and the location is great.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel has everything for the budget-minded traveller who just needs a base, and I found it perfect for sight-seeing.

review.reviewText: Terrible mattress!!!

review.title: Nice hotel and staff. Close to the local shops.
review.reviewText: Nice and friendly staff. Free parking. Close to local restaurants and shops. Nice to be away from the touristy spots yet not too far.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and knowledgable staff about the city.
review.locationRemarks: Near great restaurants and boutiques.

review.title: Very overpriced.
review.reviewText: Wallpaper coming off. Toilet cracked. Free breakfast of pastries, coffee and juice had to taken to the room. Parking slots very tight. Because of loud noise of street, staff supplies earplugs.
review.negativeRemarks: Almost everything.

review.title: Three days in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel was good a little over priced I think for what you get.
review.positiveRemarks: Bit tricky to et anywhere on foot
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee fasciities
review.locationRemarks: Quite a walk fromfishermans wharf and union square was a bus ride which was ok once we worked it out. Staff on reception desk were great

review.title: Very disappointed
review.reviewText:
The elevator is very old and did not work.
We had to change the key to the room several times as we could not open the door.
There was only one plastic glass to use in the room.
The soap is so thin that you can't get any suds to wash your body.
Very old television.
The room was large but the decor very depressing.
The continental breakfast was so bad that we had to go a restaurant for breakfast
I would be embarrassed to recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: There was not a thing that I liked.
review.negativeRemarks: Please read again what I wrote about our experience at this hotel and it will clearly tell you the things that need to be improved.

review.title: Nice Location
review.reviewText: Close walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Decent hotel/room for the price and location, with free parking bonus. Hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating.

review.title: Inexpensive tourist hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this on a last-minute rate offer which was pretty good, and got better when I got there because parking and internet was free. Isn't it odd that 4 or 5 star pretentious places all ding you and ding you good for parking and in-room internet. How odd. As if I would pay extra for these things just because a hotel has a restaurant and obsequious bell men. Geez, if you need room service in a San Francisco hotel of all places you should just stay home and have the maid fix it for you.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost, amenities, comfortable bed, large room
review.negativeRemarks: parking spaces were a bit tight. Need to upgrade to high def flat screen TV, noise from Lombard street could be a problem for light sleepers
review.locationRemarks: This is in the Marina District. Close to the Marina restaurant strip and the spectacular waterfront and Fort Mason events. More of a hike to Pier 39

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: It is obviously an older hotel and in many other locations, the price would be exorbitant. But for San Francisco $300 per night including parking and in a good neighborhood is excellent. It is clean, the staff is great, we were very pleased and would recommend it.
review.negativeRemarks: Just the decor.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf and right in the thick of things.

review.title: OK for the money
review.reviewText:
The staff was very nice. It was well priced when you included the taxes and free parking. Complimentary continental breakfast was bare-bones, but on the flipside, we didn't have to go in search of something for breakfast. The room's chair really needed a cleaning, but other than that, the room seemed clean, albiet lacking up-to-date amenties/decor (90's styling). Bed was reasonably comfortable. Pillows were sortof ok (but we are very picky on pillows). Bathroom was very spacious (we may have had a handicapped unit?). Towels were were reasonable in size/stiffness, but not something you'd want at home.
Nothing about the entire property/amenties was luxurious, but if you want a place that is within walking distance of the Pier 39(20 minutes, a little over 1 mile level/downhill) , a reasonably comfortable bed, clean, and convenient onsite parking, and you plan on spending your time in the city rather than in the hotel, than this could be a good place for you to hang your hat for a night or two.
IF you want triple sheeting, down pillow, superior bed, updated decor, etc then this is not the place for you.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Pier 39 for those in reasonably good health.

review.title: Cheap hotel on popular street
review.reviewText: Clean and last minute choice. Checked in quick and we enjoyed our stay. Parking was the only problem as it's limited and extremely tight. Not good for big vehicles.

review.title: good location and price for the area
review.reviewText: The room was small and if road noise is a problem for you do not stay here road noise goes on all night long. ... parking is tight and they double park cars but if you look around it is a common practice with all the hotels in the area...
review.negativeRemarks: The room we had was small but our neighbors room was much bigger. We found out when we were leaving that we were in the small room...
review.locationRemarks: All the San Francisco attraction are in the area the docks are about 12 minute walk away.....

review.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff and close to pier 39.
review.reviewText: The staff was really friendly and helpful. They gave me a free map. The location was really good, very close to pier 39. However, the surrounding area wasn't very lively and the parking situation is very limited.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the friendly staff
review.negativeRemarks: The parking lot
review.locationRemarks: Pier 39 and fishermans wharf

review.title: Free parking at this hotel
review.reviewText: If you would like to save $$ and avoid paying parking in SF, then this is a good chice. Walking distance to cable car stop, crookest street...but the room is a bit old. Staffs are very friendly!

review.title: A perfectly satisfactory hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: We were looking for a place to stay for a few nights that was moderately priced, clean, and close to the classic San Francisco attractions, and this hotel fit the bill perfectly. It's not a 5-star place or anything, and it IS right in the city, so it's not the highest end as far as quality, but we found very little to complain about. My close to 8-months pregnant wife and I thought the room was nice and quiet (as far as a hotel room in the middle of a busy city can be), and the neighborhood seemed as safe as (or safer than) any we drove through to get there. It was even close enough for us to walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39, which is something considering the in utero baby we had in tow. The breakfast left something to be desired, and the staff wasn't overly officious, but we didn't have many needs, and our experience was better than we expected (not to mention that free parking!).
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to many tourist attractions, the rooms were clean and satisfactory, and there was plenty of free parking. Good price for the location.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast was lackluster (though there was SOMEthing at least), and the linens weren't the highest quality.
review.locationRemarks: VERY close to the bay and all the tourist attractions there. Within walking distance to Pier 39/Alcatraz/Fisherman's Wharf/etc.

review.title: It was okay for the price.
review.reviewText: The price was right. We got a lot of excerise walking to the Wharf. I was a little disappointed with the information give to us about driving verses parking at the California Academy of Science. We were told parking was $9 so we decided to drive. It ended up costing us $25.
review.positiveRemarks: The overall staff friendliness and willing to help.
review.negativeRemarks: the room set up was a little unorganized.
review.locationRemarks: we decided to walk to the wharf to avoid the hassle of finding parking and the cost. That was a big plus for choosing this locaiton. FREE parking. W

review.title: OK for San fran.

review.title: Noisy, Noisy, Noisy
review.reviewText: If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel with very helpful staff which is exceptionally NOISY, this is the place for you. We asked for a quiet room and were put in a second floor, street facing room which is approximately 15 yards/50 feet from Lombard Street, one of the busiest streets in SF. Close the door and it still sounds like you are standing in the middle of the street. This hotel was built before double glazing was invented. So off to reception we go and we were moved to a considerably quieter room not facing Lombard Street but still very noisy. Put a real damper on our SF stay as cancellation policy is you lose one nights cost.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff in all instances were exceptionally helpful and considerate, except when we checked in and asked for a quiet room!

review.title: Francisco Bay Inn

We went down to complain about it since we had to use our phones to try to see where we were going and there was another lady already there that had fallen down 2 steps due to the light issue. The girl at the desk didn't offer to give her a discount for the night or anything of the sort. She just said "well I have to turn them on manually and I was busy - sorry but they are on now..." I wont be staying here again.

review.title: Perfect for a quick SF trip
review.reviewText: Great location. Good neighborhood. Not sketchy or seedy at all. Within walking distance to Ghiradelli (sp?) square and the crooked part of Lombard St. Free parking is hard to find in San Fran- No complaints about the hotel except parking was tight. It's okay you'll get a spot if you arrive late. They double park cars if necessary. If youre blocking someone in, the front desk holds your keys. Standard rooms. Nothing to write home about, but they are clean and comfy for a few nights! They offer coffee and pastries in the morning, butI didn't partake in the breakfast (I'm vegan, so I brought my own breakfast goodies). Glad they had a fridge and microwave in the room. I'd totally stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator is slow and small. Difficult if you are handicapped.
review.locationRemarks: Good neighborhood
review.userLocation: San Pedro, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Not great but not bad for the price.
review.reviewText:
The rooms are clean but not very inviting and the decor is very dated. The bathroom is very spacious and clean though. There is virtually no sound proofing so through out the night you will hear traffic and it gets loud.
The hotel is located at a very convenient place and is close to most of the attractions including Fisherman's Wharf and Golden Gate bridge.
It is one of the few hotels that offer free parking but the space provided is very narrow. If you're not petite, forget about getting out of your car once you parked.
If you're on a budget and just need to crash for a day or two, it is one of your best options in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Room and decor
review.locationRemarks: It is close to major attractions, Fishermans' wharf is just a mile away

review.title: Great Hotel for your budget.
review.reviewText: It was in real good location, walking distance from Lombard street. Hop on-hop off tour bus stop was exactly in from of the hotel.

review.title: Not a pleasant experience
review.reviewText:
My experience at this hotel was awful. My room was on the 2nd floor and had paper thin walls and apparently the ceiling as well. I heard every movement of the people next to me and above me. It sounded like they were dropping bowling balls every night (and I heard nearly every word of their 3 am argument on my second night). Street noise is very loud (as expected in a city), though I am used to it so it didn't bother me too much, but Lombard is a very busy street around the clock. You can hear/feel people walking past the room.

Wi-fi is spotty at best, non-existent at times. The TV is from the '90s and the furniture is wood laminate and looked like it was purchased from a used office furniture store. I read that the rooms were recently remodeled and I shutter to think what the decor was before, because what it was upgraded to is not very attractive.

Parking is free, but very limited. They have to double park some cars, and I didn't use my car at night for fear of coming back to the hotel without a place to park.

This is billed as a budget hotel, and I suppose you sacrifice some conveniences with a lower cost. But what I expect in any hotel is to be able to relax in my room after a day of sightseeing, and in the entire time I was there that didn't happen once. Way too loud from other guest rooms, kids running around the property or the staff vacuuming (not their fault, they are just doing their job, but the thin walls don't help).

I will never stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleaning staff was nice and did a good job.
review.negativeRemarks: It's very loud from the street and from rooms above and to the side. Decor is very drab. Parking is limited. Wi-fi is unreliable.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to the Golden Gate bridge (by car).

We arrived about 5pm and got the last park, after that you have to double park and leave you keys. We parked our car out the back and were parked in with a car parked behind us on the street. But reception sorted this out quickly and the car was moved.
Location was ok with a few reasonable restaurants and shops nearby.
The only real downer was the road noise. We were pretty tired from driving from LA and slept, but did hear the traffic. It died down late at night. Price was a bit high considering the hotel is dated and noisey.

review.title: Francisco Bay Inn
review.reviewText: This was a disappointing first visit to San Francisco. The information and photo supplied with the Expedia site was not at all what we had when we got there. There was barely enough room to walk round the king bed in the room. There was no place to sit other than the bed.

review.title: Too Expensive
review.reviewText: My GF and I flew down to Anaheim to pickup a Vette and were driving it back up Hwy101 to Seattle. This hotel was our second and next to last night of the drive. The hotel itself was a pain to drive to with GPS taking us thru the heart of San Fran. Once we got there, the hotel was a pretty hefty walk to the wharf and crooked street. Neither of us complained about vehicle traffic or road noise, my complaint is about parking, our room and breakfast. For the price, I expected WAY more than we got. Parking was jammed packed with vehicles double parked; I was nervous about my new Vette getting dinged. Our room was a little crazy; you could literally feel every spring in the mattress and there was a big sag in the middle. The bathroom had 8 light switches and four of them did nothing. Also, our room shared an entrance with another room and those people would stand in the aisle in front of our shared entrance smoking their stuff. You could also hear their door open and close every time. The breakfast in the morning was horrible....ran out of everything, even coffee. It was the worst breakfast of the three hotels we stayed in on this trip. We ended up going to a restaurant. The attached pic is a view of the Golden Gate from the rooftop deck....the best part of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, breakfast, and the room itself
review.locationRemarks: Hefty walk to wharf but crooked street was reasonable

Breakfast was pretty bad - packaged pastries and some fruit, instant coffee etc..but for the price I wasn't expecting a full on buffet.

The staff were pleasant and courteous. I also managed to be checked in an hour early, which I wasn't expecting. Altogether a nice experience for the price.

review.title: Budget Hotel close-ish to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: This place isn't fancy, but it's just fine -- especially if you're looking for a hotel in SF that's a bit cheaper than the major chains. The staff couldn't be friendlier and the free parking is a huge bonus in a city where lots can cost $40/day. Our room was clean and the bathroom spotless, though the decor has not been renovated. The hotel is four blocks from a city bus stop, and we found we were able to get around without much trouble at all (we walked to Fisherman's Wharf, about 20 minutes at kid pace). There is street noise, but it's traffic street noise, which I prefer over pedestrian-tourists-on-the-sidewalk street noise that I imagine some places in more densely touristy areas must experience. One warning: the continental breakfast is just a few pastries and instant coffee...
