And the best part was the free parking. We thought it was a great value especially since we spent so little time there and most of our time enjoying the city. We would stay here again!
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf

review.title: guest
review.reviewText:
"You get what you pay for" is a pretty good description of the hotel room. The room wasn't meticulously clean, but it was ok. Free parking and free internet are pluses and good values for the price paid. However.... when I was booking the hotel, I saw some review comments about the noises from the street and from upstair unit's footsteps. I didn't think that was a big deal, so I still booked a room there anyway. But when I stayed there, the problem was a lot worse than I had imagined. The noise from the street wasn't bad at all, but the noise from upstair was appalling. Those people returned to their room late at night. I'm not sure what they were actually doing in the upstair room, but from my room, it sounded like they were jumping up and down or throwing things around. Their every footstep was not only so loud, it actually made my room's ceiling shake to a point that the ceiling lights were flickering. I was starting to fear that the ceiling may collapse on me any time. The reception desk closes at 11 pm, and there was no hotel staff answering any phone calls after 11 pm. I could not ask them to change room at that point, and had no choice but put up with the noise and unstable ceiling.

After this experience, I am wonder whether the hotel building is actually structurally safe.

review.title: NOT IMPRESSED!
review.reviewText: I strongly recommend you NOT stay at this hotel. Customer service was appalling. Not helpful at all. Wireless doesn't work properly nor does TV. Rooms are 20years older than they look in the pictures.

review.title: The place to stay in San Fran on a budget!
review.reviewText: We were looking for a decent priced hotel with a great location and free parking and it's a hard thing to accomplish with one hotel but this one did it. It's only 3 blocks from the historic Lombard St section and a Cable Car pickup point. The parking helps because you can end up paying a ton just to park in San Fran. It was comfortable and clean and we will definitely stay there again when we visit San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: We just tried to avoid the Tenderloin neighborhood

review.title: Wouldn't stay here again for any price
review.reviewText: Room smelled like a cat sprayed in there, tiny room, noisy from outside traffic, tiny OLD elevators, no HBO. It's an Old hotel that was propped up with a few upgrades like a refridgerator and microwave. At least a mile from pier 39 which was fine since the bus was only a block and a half away, but the front desk couldn't even make change for the ride and recommended going to the nearest convenience store. Would have taken my car to the wharf but wasn't sure if there would still be parking at the hotel when I got back. Didn't even bother with the continental breakfast after reading the poor reviews the night I stayed. Would not stay here again and would consider a hotel miles away for a comparable rate and better place to stay.

review.title: Won't go back!
review.reviewText: The internet is really poor and going down to reception to get a bowl of cereal is a joke. It really over sells itself.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Competitive price + parking, these are about all of its assets. Complimentary breakfast was a joke.

review.title: Price is right. Decent place to stay if you are not looking for luxury
review.reviewText: My room was clean. The staffs are not very chatty but I wouldn't say they are not friendly. Fairly close to the piers with good selection of shops and restaurants in the area.

review.title: So so hotel
review.reviewText: Although parking was free, too many cars for small parking area. Had to double park and leave keys at front desk. The room was clean and everything seemed to work well; even had a microwave and mini fridge in room. Front desk could be a little more friendly to customers. The hotel was close to the G Square but it was a LONG 45-minute walk to get there. Even a longer walk if planning to walk to Pier 39 where al the action is. So if you're looking for a good deal, I suppose this is an okay place. Just be prepared to walk.

review.title: Would go back there again.
review.reviewText: Good location, very knowledgeable and helpful staff in office. City Bus is within a block, very easy to navigate thru city.

review.title: For quick stay only
review.reviewText: This hotel is ok for a short stay and if you're not going to spend any time in the room. The hotel rooms are old. The bathroom was clean. The carpet is filthy, I would only walk on it with my socks on. The overall decor is old. The ac/heater is noisy. The location is pretty good.

review.title: good locaton
review.reviewText: hotel was in a good spot.... front desk staff were not very good, neither was the breakfast, but rooms were clean and comfy

review.title: OK to stay for the free parking
review.reviewText: The front desk employees weren't that friendly. The lady behind the counter only smiled when she was trying to push a tour from a brochure she had on the counter; which the hotel would probably get a kick-back from the booking. The location is a little noisy and it's about 1 mile from the Warf.

review.title: didn't feel welcome.
review.reviewText:
we recieved 2 rooms, one was very smelly, so we asked for another one. We could change without problems. Lady was polite ar the front desk.

In the morning small breakfast was ok but the man at the front desk had been extremly unfriendly. He asked us to go outside for breakfast and it was very cold outside.

we didn't feel very welcomed and we can not recommend this hotel - although the rooms were quite clean and had good beds.

review.title: Wouldn't do it again!
review.reviewText:
Before I made my reservations I read several of the reviews by others that had stayed here. They made it sound as though it wasn't that bad of a place to stay. Since it seemed to be a little misleading I'll try to make this as accurate as possible.

It's just a hotel. That's all you can say about it. If you're looking for a place that has a bed, is clean, and you don't mind paying about the same rate as you would a 3 star then knock yourself out. The place is run down somewhat but kept in a stable condition. It definitely doesn't catch your eye when you drive by and it also gives you that "oh what have I done" feeling when you walk in. I will say that the room seemed to be very clean as well as the bathroom.... almost to a level that was impressive. However, it doesn't change the fact that its run down. The elevator works but is extremely slow. It just makes you feel that you have a 50/50 shot of actually making it to your floor before it plummets to the ground. It is extremely noisy there as its right next to a very busy street. Those that had commented on the noise were 100% right. I'm a very heavy sleeper so it didn't bother me but it did others in my party. As far as the location, its definitely a hike to get anywhere. To sum it all up, I actually changed hotels to one that was much closer to Pier 39 and was much happier!

review.title: worth the dirt cheap rate
review.reviewText: this place is prime location, 5 minute walk to the wharf and/or marina area. not a super nice place but i wans't there that much and in the end, you get what you pay for. boom.

review.title: too loud in frisco
review.reviewText: staff not very friendly,

review.title: Wouls definitely stay in this Hotel again!
review.reviewText: At first I was afraid of how the room was going to smell due to a review I read but once I entered the room I noticed the windows had been left opened. So thankfully I didnâ€™t have a bad experience due to bad odors. But I do have to say for the price I paid, the stay was well worth it. However, if you look forward to the continental then you may be disappointed. The food was not fresh and in saying not fresh I mean old or stale.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: The motel room was very clean, perfect location walking distance from the pier. The only issue I had was with front desk staff, one man was extremely rude...I had asked him for driving directions to pier he provided wrong directions and said if I drive i will not find parking...Parking was too easy to find and cheap!

review.title: we may go back
review.reviewText: Generally we were satisfied with our hotel. Its location was good, we didn't have a parking problem,when the parking lot is full they make you park behind another car, which is also helpful. Rooms are ok when you think the price you paid. unfortunately we founfd the breakfast very weak. and we were glad that we had a room at the back of the hotel, so we didn't have noise problem.

review.title: Expediamania
review.reviewText: I dont recommend this hotel

review.title: Bad reception
review.reviewText:
Everyone in SF during my 3 weeks there on vacation was extremely friendly EXCEPT at the reception of this hotel.
The woman who did the check in/out didn't even look at me when speaking, didn't smile once, and was unpleasant.
She made me wait on purpose and talked to me very nasty.
Breakfast was supposed to be served till 9.00 am, but at 8.30 there was almost nothing left to eat. It's quite early when you are on vacation...

review.title: Might stay there again.
review.reviewText: I liked it for the price, very cute. The bed was a bit hard, and the satellite tv cut out just a little. I would definitely stay here again though, it's an older building and I really liked it.

review.title: Not a bad choice
review.reviewText:
I was pleased with most aspects about the hotel however I was very disappointed that they didn't receive emails from me.
I had emailed once to confirm my booking. That was fine but when I emailed to ask about the shuttle I received nothing back. I sent 3 emails and was told upon arrival that no emails were received. I am perplexed.
At 1am revelers arrived and socialised outside our room for an hour when the next group arrived. It was a bit noisy.

review.title: Worst Hotel we stayed in USA
review.reviewText: The Hotel had a good location and a satisfactory room, but the staff were terrible. They were rude and arrogant. Breakfast was very basic and had to be taken back to your room. When I asked for an item that had run out I was accused of taking more than my share. Do not stay here find somewhere else.

review.title: READ THIS!
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights, couldn't sleep at all. Traffic noise too loud (even over a white noise app I downloaded and tried in desperation), creaky floorboards from the guests above, and double and triple parked cars being moved at all hours setting each other's car alarms off!! However, if sleep is not your thing, it's awesome...

review.title: nothing fancy.
review.reviewText: Room was decent in size. The lady in the front office was helpfull with the tours. The room was clean. the only bad thing was that in the night the room had an odor of Curry. Don't know if the room was above the office kitchen. The room key didn.t work after two uses. had to reprogram it.

review.title: We will be back~
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. It was not only clean and smelled good it also had a frig, microwave, coffee maker and full size ironing board included, as well as free parking. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I am sure we will be coming back to this hotel. The price was very reasonable for all that was included. Only thing, the elevator was out of order but the stairs are short. Also the hot and cold water are reversed. Other than those things, it was very worth it. We even extended our stay one more night.

review.title: Will definately stay there again.
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and situated in a very nice rea of town. My only complaint was the tub did not drain very well.

review.title: Good Value for money
review.reviewText: Bed was comfortable room was tidy

review.title: Absolutely a major disappointment
review.reviewText: Horrible!!!

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: An older hotel in a good location. Adequate is the best way to describe this hotel. Our room was clean. Located on a busy street, but I took a sound machine & slept fine. Breakfast was pastries, fruit, muffins, & juice. On sight parking which is a hot commodity in San Fran. We had a king sized bed, non-smoking room, w/ fridge, microwave, coffee pot, & hair dryer. With the money we saved on the hotel we were able to spend more on activities. I would stay there again.

review.title: Any port in a storm
review.reviewText:
With all of the activities going on the weekend we were in San Francisco, Fleet Week, the Giants in the playoffs, etc., plus having most of the hotels/motels already booked for Friday/Saturday weekend, we took what we could get. I expected more for the prices we paid - at least a contential breakfast (as avertised) that did not include stale pastries and, get this, instant coffee. They did offer free parking whereas most of the other placed charged $20 - $25 per night to park. If you returned early enough you got a parking space. If not, you had to double-up behind another car and leave you keys with the desk clerk in case the car you parked behind wanted out; which was the case both nights.

The traffic noise on Lombard Street was quite loud - well into the early morning hours. The motel was centrally located to our needs and the staff was very helpful with providing driving directions to various locations.

Bottom line - it served our needs but was overpriced for what was advertised.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great Location, very nice and clean room, recommend to others.

review.title: Not bad for a decent price
review.reviewText: Our room was pretty small, but who cares if you're going to go out and look at things? The bathroom was almost the same size as the room (it was a huge bathroom). Nice tub to give the baby a bath. The hot and cold water were reversed in the sink and the tub, but once you get used to it it doesn't matter. We asked for a room in the back so we didn't hear too much traffic. Parking is a real tight squeeze. It takes several tries, but it's free. Some places charge $40/day! The breakfast is some muffins/donuts that you have to eat in your room. If you try to eat it in the lobby they'll kick you out (in not the most friendly way). If you don't get there pretty close to the start you may miss out. It didn't look like they replenish supply.

review.title: Ok for guys on a budget.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a clear advantage of price and location, however don't expect friendly service or the the hotel to be clean. If mng. was changed could be a neat little place to spend a few nights.

review.title: Pretty good..
review.reviewText: The pictures make the hotels look better, however my experience there was still good. It was in a good location.

review.title: Complete rubbish
review.reviewText:
If you want an expensive, dirty, smelly hotel stay here!!!
Hotel Review: Hotel was no better than a very cheap motel, yet cost LOADS MORE, Room was dirty, smelly and the toilet was cracked..... I would not reccomend anyone stay there.....An example of value for money is MGM Grand in Las Vegas half the cost for 2 nights.....

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Very old hotel and staff not very accomedating. I requested a non-smoking room and as soon as we walked in I could tell that that was not the case, the room reeked of smoke (just because they put a sign up on the TV that read No-smoking, doesn't make it a non-smoking room). The location was ok, it was about a 15-20 minute walk to the pier. I don't think I will ever go back to this hotel as it was over priced for the condition and service.

review.title: Rude attendant
review.reviewText: I lived in SF for the last 10 years and was back in town for business. I brought my wife and baby to this hotel for one night and was taken back by how rude and uncaring the attendant was. She did not project a kind SF attitude and that really sucks.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for price and location. It was great for walking down to Fisherman's Wharf where it is almost impossible to find affordable parking for the day. It was clean and the lady at the front desk was pretty helpful with tourist attractions we should visit.

review.title: it's OK.....
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff were slightly abrupt at times, although helpful when asking directions.
The hotel is in a good location for fisherman's wharf pier 39 and Crookedest street. Which are all within a gentle 15-20 min walk.
In terms of cleanliness... there was a slightly odd smell of onions in the room, which didn't improve or pass. It was slightly noisy being on a main road.
Ok for a stop off... not somewhere i'd want to spend more than a couple of nights

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Basic accomodation, excellent location and clean. A good mid budget option close to Fishermans wharf area.

review.title: Quality hotel and service
review.reviewText: Staff at the front desk were more than willing to answer questions and help me out.

review.title: I'll surely recommend it!
review.reviewText: Upon arrival the Hotel personnel is pleasant and no hassles on registration though I book the Hotel by Expedia...room is nice the area is really close to the place where tourist like me wants to see in San Francisco. Location is Great but u can hear cars passing by but it's alright we are tired anyway so we just sleep thru it. Good thing they serve breakfast and the personnel is very accommodating...they helped you if you have question...Thanks Francisco Bay Inn...I absulutely will recommend your Hotel.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: I personally like this hotel, it is well equiped with hair dryer and even iron. Price is worth for the room in good location there, it is just close to Lombard Street, one of attractions in San Francisco. However, please expect slow respond of their lift, you need more patient on it.

review.title: Good value for the price.
review.reviewText: Very happy with booking with Expedia. I was nervous because I had never gone through Expedia before but I got exactly what I expected and booked. Would use Expedia again.

review.title: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, highly recomended.
review.reviewText: Arived and promplty given room and access keys. There was some type of renovation going on, but it did not interfere at at all with guest. The room was cozy, clean, and comfortable. It was busy outside in the street, but as it got later, the streets were quiet. It felt safe. Pleanty of parking spaces available, I got a good parking spot where I could keep an eye on my car. The walls were a little thin, and I could hear people above walking around, but a little noise dosen't bother me. In the morning the staff was friendly, and courteous. Pleanty of site seeing literature available, and fresh coffe. The location is good, very close to a lot of site seeing in SF. The area was good, not ghetto at all. Overal a great place to stay, whether you are traveling alone or with family. I highly recomend this place.

review.title: They can do better if they would want to
review.reviewText: The only minuses is their beds are falling apart, on breakfast you have to go to check in office get some muffins with coffee and then you have to go back to your room to eat.

review.title: Will come back again
review.reviewText: Decent hotel and good location

review.title: Simple convenient economic lodging
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel, Gret Location, Onsight Parking, Great rates. It met my needs perfectly.

review.title: Great deal, great location
review.reviewText: Great location, great value, clean room, front desk staff is helpful. I stay here a lot. Ask for back rooms for quieter sleep. Front rooms face Lombard which is very noisy. Elevator is slow but usually works. Entrance to hotel parking is confusing, tell Taxi drivers to take Franklin St from downtown. Driveway is off Franklin.

review.title: Good value.
review.reviewText: It was a comfortable hotel, clean and in a convenient location.

review.title: Very good location if you visit SF by car
review.reviewText:
The best things about this hotel are the location and the price; almost on the corner of the Van Ness blvd en Lombardstreet; close to Fisherman's Warf
(5 minute walk.)

Th rooms are not as big as we were used to in Las Vegas, but everything was in there. Because there where two queensize beds in the room, there was not very much place left for our suitcases left. The lady at the frontdesk was very helpfull for all our questions.

At last, I don't think it is a familyhotel; by bad weather there is nothing to do for little children.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: I recently stayed here and I had a good stay. The people were friendly, the room was clean and comfortable. There wasn't much room to park your vehicle though, but it's a cramped city anyway!!!

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: We stayed here during November as we were on our way around California. We booked this on the net and did not really expect that much because of the price (very reasonable). We were very plesently suprised, the rooms were clean and of a good standard, it was in a quite area and so we were able to get some much needed sleep. The location was great, within walking distance of the main attractions in San Fran, Fishermans Wharf etc. The gentleman on reception was also always willing to help with directions and recommendations of where to go, day and night. In general the hotel was in a good location, great price and suited our needs 100%. Thank you for making our stay a great one.

review.title: Great Find! Will be staying here regularly
review.reviewText: Great hotel, the only reasons I didn't give all 5's are: The bed frame looked like something from my grandma's house, the continental breakfast is a complete joke (nothing more than a few vending machine pastries, croissants and coffee with nowhere to sit and eat anything). The other reason I didnt give a 5 is that the staff isnt exactly friendly. Just seems to be all business to them and not much for making you feel welcome. Other than that this place is great, great location, good prices, free parking and nice rooms.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a good location. Short walk to Fishermans Wharf, the marina, and the Fort Mason/GGB area. Also plenty of little eateries and grocers in the area. The bus stop is a short walk away, which is by far the best and easiest way to get around town. I thought the streetcars were going to be the way, but they're expensive and don't go to many areas, the buses cover it all just pick up a map. My hotel room was nice and clean. Good bed, clean sheets. Bathroom was bigger than your typical hotel room and was clean as well. TV was kinda small and the reception wasn't too great, but I only watched it at night falling asleep and in the morning while packing my bag, so it wasn't a huge deal. The 'breakfast' the hotel has is a joke, but I just went to a great cafe a few blocks away, so I would suggest a similar path. Traffic noise outside the hotel started getting loud early, but I had to wake up early anyways so no big deal. All in all, not a bad stay. If you're looking to stay in a safe area that is walking distance to some locations and want to keep the price down, it's a great choice!

review.title: A decent value and good location
review.reviewText: I found the staff to be very nice and helpful. The rooms were very clean. The double beds were a little on the small side, but comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious, good for getting ready. Good location for the Presidio area and Ghiradelli area.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: This hotel is good for a short stay, free parking, rooms are clean.

review.title: The check in staff was rude
review.reviewText: The check in staff was rude-acted as if I was bothering her. Otherwise, stay was fine.

review.title: inconvinient location
review.reviewText: the parking spaces are so small and against the wall on both sides that once you find a parking space you can't get out of your car. elevator was not running so had to carry suitcase up three flights of stairs. no table in room had no where to sit but bed. the front desk person did't seem to care.

review.title: Much better than expected
review.reviewText: We read some negative reviews on TripAdvisor so weren't sure what to expect. But we were pleasantly surprised - the room was clean, comfortable and well equipped and the location excellent. There was some traffic noise, but not to an extent that it stopped us sleeping. Service was fine though we didn't have any problems to deal with. Free parking was a bonus. A great base for exploring San Francisco - we didn't spend much time at the hotel itself.

review.title: Surly staff
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is ideally located for us with decent parking,the staff at the front desk leaves a lot to be desired.on two occasions,they were very rude.We will not return.

review.title: Comfort
review.reviewText: Francisco Bay was clean, comfortable and in a good location. My only problem with the hotel was parking was awful.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Right on a busy street, so a little noisy at night

review.title: Good location with reasonable price comes with fredge& microwave and clean bathroom!
review.reviewText: Perfect location walk distance to the fishermans whalf san francisco, easy access to air port and golden gate bridge. very nice european style elevator.

review.title: Great location, great price, very difficult and rude staff
review.reviewText: Very rude front desk staff which made our stay uncomfortable to say the least. The lobby was locked so you couldn't even get in to get their travel brochures or a cup of coffee before the posted breakfast time. Front dest staff changed the breakfast time each day. They served instant coffee with powdered creamer. On the plus side, the room was clean, had a fridge and microwave and the hotel is in a prime location. It's affordable.

review.title: Worth for the money
review.reviewText: Near to the tourist spots, downtown, and very cheap price

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: This hotel was centrally located which means not real close to anything, but you can walk to union square (1 hour) or to the wharf (15 minutes) or to the bus stop (1 block). You want a bus pass because the walk from Union square at night is uncomfortable and from the Wharf it is uphill. you can also catch a bus to the west side (presidio, bridge etc) if you dont mind riding public transportation. We saved about $50 per night over other hotels closer to the wharf but the hotel was noisy with traffic on Lombard street and people walking upstairs. The "breakfast" was basic muffins, OJ and INSTANT coffee with bananas half the time (you had to take it back to your room) so we usually went out for real coffee after. Since we did not go to San Francisco to spend a lot of time in a hotel room, it was okay.We could spend the extra $200 on other stuff.

review.title: Surprised at low quality
review.reviewText: Bed sagging and uncomfortable. One of two elevators did not work. Barely any room between the bed and the wall. The room was very noisy due to auto traffic below.

review.title: I would not recommend for a leisure trip
review.reviewText: If you just want to save some bucks, then it might be what you expected. However, their are not prepared for leisure at all. You need to take the breakfast to your bedroom and there is no place to eat it there. The parking is a confusion and the receptionists just don't like moving the cars.. so you need to be patient! One night we were tired and preferred t opark at the street. The room was small and had a strong smell, so we needed to keep the windows opened for a while before sleeping.

review.title: Not a good hotel at all!
review.reviewText: The bedroom stinks, the breakfast ends really early and they do not replace it (so if you want to eat after 8:30am, do not count on the hotel's breakfast). The parking is a complete mess. One of the receptionists was completely rude when we asked if we could park our cars together. In the morning, we almost got late to return the car at the agency and get our flight because they took too long to move the other cars to let us out. The hotel was a complete disappointment and a good reason for making us upset.

review.title: basic - gets the job done
review.reviewText: simple room. affordable price. clean.

review.title: NOT CLOSE TO FISHERMAN WARF OR ANYTHING
review.reviewText: Yes there is free parking but you have to walk a mile or more just to get to beginning of the warf. I will pay more for a closer and nicer hotel room next time. The hotel parking was a joke it tanom so you have to wait for someone to move a car so you can move your car. Room was clean and front clerks were very nice but I recommend pay the extra cash and go to a name brand hotel

review.title: Good price for the location
review.reviewText: For the most part, we were satisfied with this hotel. The location was great for the price and the free parking was key. The only downside was the smoke detector in the hallway, which beeped throughout the night.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: This hotel seemed to be inexpensive for San Francisco. It was clean confortable offered a basic breakfast. It is a bit of a walk from the Fishermans Wharf area but the buses were fairly easy to use. We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and this hotel.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: for the money

review.title: Not worth it!
review.reviewText: The price was good for such a late planned trip, but the people at the front desk were not polite in any way. When I asked for them to call a cab for me they had a "friend" drive me where I needed to go and I was very uncomfortable with that. I then called cabs directly instead of asking for their help. The room was small and the it's a very noisy location right at a traffic light.

review.title: just ok
review.reviewText: Nothing special but it satisfied my minimum expectation for the price.

review.title: Francisco Bay Inn
review.reviewText: Just a great location, everything within reach and free parking, breakfast and internet. Clean and spacious, friendly staff and hotel will book great tours for you. So worth it! Would definitely go again, so reasonable, too!

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: good location for walking around.

review.title: Just OK For The Price
review.reviewText: We arrived at 1:45 to check in. The place looked clean but the lady at the front desk wasn't very friendly. We had our six month old daughter with us, unfortunately she had no room for us until 3:00pm so we had to wait over an hour outside the lobby for her to give us a room. I really felt, considering the baby that she could of let us check in 1 hour early.

review.title: ***FREE PARKING***
review.reviewText: Good Value. Nice Location. Free Parking.

review.title: Okay, but not memorable
review.reviewText: Easy walking to Fishermans Wharf or Chinatown. Instant coffee w/continental breakfast. Several good restaurants along Lombard nearby. All in all, it's okay for a 2 or 3 day stay.

review.title: great local close to every thing
review.reviewText: greate place to stay for the money in san fran.

review.title: Very Relaxing stay at Francisco Bay Inn
review.reviewText: The inn had great service! The hotel staff was friendly and very helpful towards our touristy needs. The rooms itself were clean and had the basic amenities required by guests. Their big plus was that they offered free parking for guests so we did not have to worry about our car while we walked over to nearby attractions. My husband enjoyed the free wifi internet as well as he was able to take care of his business emails from the hotel. Overall, we are very satisfied and would return to this particular hotel for our next trip to san francisco as the price was right and the value was even better!

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Liked the location, near wharf, good price weekday, clean, not too noisy...for a big city, free wireless, helpful staff, free parking a big plus, nice contenental brkfast, but rather early checkout, 11am, overall a good deal, would stay again

review.title: Value Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location for a great price. 2 blocks from Lombard street.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located and good service arrnaged by hotel owners for airport shuttles, tour buses. The staff is friendly with good local city knowledge to suggest to visitors.

review.title: Great hotel depnding on rates
review.reviewText: I could not fault the hotel, except perhaps that there was no internet station provided for guests. The staff were friendly and helpful and knew the area well. I booked through Expedia and got a very good rate. I think that in peak times this rate goes quite high. Check the rates and make your own decision.

review.title: not impressed.
review.reviewText: the pricing was a bit high for the quality your getting.

review.title: Great location, good value
review.reviewText: Was a great location to walk just a block and catch the MUNI bus anywhere you want to go. Actually walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf. Room was clean and comfy and good value for San Francisco.

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. It is impressive in cleanliness, and parking.

review.title: Unfriendly, rude people at the reception
review.reviewText: The hotel was OK, but the people were really rude, they wanted us to pay 10 bucks for parking a car one our before the registration. The bed was old, there was no place to take a breakfast, people have to take it to their rooms to eat.

review.title: INFLEXIBLE!
review.reviewText: NO customer service.

review.title: Nice place to stay, great price
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean, comfortable, no hassle. Room was a bit small, but the bathroom was huge. Decent shower head and water pressure, but very short, difficult for tall people. Heater worked excellently. Room had coffee maker, god sized fridge and a microwave. Parking was free! Some of the spots were covered. Hotel is right on Lombard Street so there was traffic noise, but we really never noticed, and we are from a very rural area that is dead quiet all the time. Hotel is not within walking distance of most major sightseeing, but the front desk had ads for a shuttle service (whch we did not use, we had a car). The driving distance to the Wharf is just a mile or two. There is an elevator, but we did notice the permit was expired. The initial desk clerk was a bit gruff, but the lady who came in and actually helped us was very pleasant. If you are just looking for a reasonably priced lodging base for sightseeing and not hanging out in your room, this is the place for you.

review.title: basic accommodation but clean and comfortable. Handy to public transport.
review.reviewText: Easy walking distance to Marina and Fisherman's Wharf. Convenience stores and restaurants close by.

review.title: great place 2 stay
review.reviewText: nice rooms. huge beds.... i would stay here again..

review.title: Forget about it.
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable, but the front desk service was terrible. We had just flown 20 hours from Indonesia and wanted to eat a nice dinner and collapse before returning the airport for a morning flight. The manager was strictly amateur and took forever to check us in. He also insisted on running $25 on my credit card, which he made me sign, for incidentals. If we hadn't been so exhausted we would have gone elsewhere. The kicker was the homeless people sleeping on the walkway outside our room.

review.title: Horrible bed,
review.reviewText: check in at two pm. bad location horrible internet reception!!!!!all and all a overpriced nasty motel!!

review.title: Would not stay at this hotel again!
review.reviewText: Rooms were very small, beds were very hard. Intenet access was hit or miss and the office never acknowledged any problems; tried to blame it on my computer and the firewall. Parking was very, very tight; my husband is very thin and he was the only one who could get out of the car once it was in the parking space,also not enough spaces for all rooms so you were either blocking someone or they were blocking you.

review.title: Not a Chance
review.reviewText: This was not a good experience for us. The location is good, but for the price we expected to at least be comfortable.

review.title: Too expensive
review.reviewText: Greatly surprised at the price for the money. Turned out to be a motel with minimum amenities. Very disapointed.

review.title: Very limited appeal
review.reviewText: Although the staff were friendly the hotel overall was really the bare minimum in every respect. The rooms were small, the bathroom was large but had the distinct smell of a locker room. The "breakfast" available at the front desk was pretty much just a muffin basket and coffee. This is the kind of place if you are a single guy with no particular conveniences needed - but I would never bring my wife here. The sheets were clean and the bathrooms were in good condition (other than the smell). The unexpected pluses: the in-room MicroFridge and free wireless Internet.

review.title: Quiet for a busy street
review.reviewText: Though our room was right on a very busy street, the well insulated windows gave us a quiet, peaceful night. A clean, comfortable room, but poor TV signal.

review.title: Bring Your Walking Shoes - Far from Everything!
review.reviewText: When they say four blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, they mean four blocks from the very beginning which has nothing. To get to the piers you have to walk a mile or more. You will be doing a major amount of walking from the hotel so bring a good pair of sneakers. Also, they put a hold of $25 on your credit card for incidentals so make sure that you ask for that back when you check out. I must say the room was very nice. If I would have known how far it was to the piers I wouldn't have stayed there because I was by myself.

review.title: Interupted Sleep from intruder
review.reviewText: Apparently the doors between my room and the room next door were unlocked. I was abruptly awakened from a sound sleep at 3:30 AM by a person from the room next door bursting through the door to my room. I immediately yelled for them to get out of my room. The front desk told me the person had thought it was the door to the bathroom. Right! There are two doors to go through in a room at a hotel for the bathroom. I didn't buy that excuse. The room I was in was like an older road-side motel. Given the cost, I was quite unimpressed. The room was clean. But I am used to better accomodations for the amount I paid. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. I do not think I would spend the money to stay in this hotel again; especially after having an intruder violate my personal space and wake me up from a sound sleep.

review.title: Was O.K. for price
review.reviewText: Our main concern was the cleanlyness of the hotel and parking. We got lucky with parking our car the entire trip and the romms where clean. The hotel was close enough to all even with walking. That was to be expected anyway. It is on a main street and quite noisy but again, that did not bother us. The only thing is the front desk people. Not a freindly attmosphere at all. One did not want to ask any questions. Overall, for the price, fine for few days stay.

review.title: good location for budget value
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with hotel, room clean, bed comfortable. Walkable to fishermans wharf area in fact we walked to sights daily, also few blocks to "lombard curving street". They were also helpful booking tours that picked one up right at hotel. We felt safe even walking back to hotel at night.

review.title: Poor staff
review.reviewText: The desk staff could not break a $5 bill! They didn't know directions to anywhere. They were not helpful at all and didn't seem to care. DO NOT stay here!!!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Very poor parking and the "continental breakfast" was a few pastries.....

review.title: Good hotel on a budget
review.reviewText: A good budget hotel with an excellent location near Fisherman's wharf and the bus lines. It's not fancy and the rooms are smallish with older fixtures, but it is clean, and we had a fridge. A good way to save some cash for great seafood and tours. Tailor your expectations and you'll be happy enough. You're not going to get a fancy hotel near the wharf at this price.

review.title: Francisco Bay Inn
review.reviewText: We spend a good time. Good location, clean. Nice view and service.

review.title: Definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: great location, good price and very clean-street noise was a bit much, but that's to be expected in a big city

review.title: Great Hotel and great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly near everything in the Cow Hollow/Marina area. Convenient to all the Shops and night life but a very peaceful place to be when you come home at night...I've already recommended this hotel to a person and they will be staying there. Thanks Francisco Bay Inn

review.title: good value, comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: The only problem was with the parking. Not quite enough spaces for the rooms but that's a part of life in San Francisco. Every thing else was fine and we will definately stay there again when we return to the City by the Bay.

review.title: Impressed considering reviews
review.reviewText: Disregard bad reviews Hotel was very clean staff was great. I'm not one for Continental breakfast so I won't rate it. Parking was tight for large cars but parking was always available and free. Wireless Internet service was great. Perfect location walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf bus a bus ride to golden Gate bridge and other attactions. Stay to back of hotel since taffic is heavy if you a light sleeper. Will stay again....

review.title: can`t wait to go back
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel tp all travelers who wants comfortable room in a comfortable area in San Francisco. The staff were so nice.

review.title: Plan to go back nextg year
review.reviewText: While attending an annual event I stayed at this hotel. The price was reasonable and the location pretty good. It is a motor inn and the parking lot was crowded but I flew into town and enjoy walking so it was perfect for me. As noted in another review it is located on a noisy street but you find that most places: carry foam ear plugs. The desk was small but the bed was comfortable, the bathroom large and TV came with full basic cable plus HBO.

review.title: Watch out
review.reviewText: Sheets had holes in them. Our room was really small. They also hold your card for $25. additional dollars, you have to check out to get it back. I paid $$$ a lot for a Saturday night. Not worth this kind of price. When we got there the muffins and donuts were out after 5pm and when we came back from dinner at 10pm they were still there. The next morning same things appeared to be out, and NO fresh coffee, just instant. It might have been ok at a much lower price. range but don't expect much if you pay more. They were unfriendly.

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: good location and clean room.

review.title: Not impressed and rather disgusted
review.reviewText: Did not receive the room I reserved; Staff was not accomodating when I asked why not, they said they were booked even though the Vacancy sign outside was still lit; The room was directly across from the elevator; When I tried to use the vending machine, the dollar didn't work, I went into the office to get quarters which they gave me, and then the machine ate my quarters, when I went back into the office, they said it wasn't their vending machine. I said then the least they could do is put an "out of order" sign on it for the next hotel guests that tried to use it. I highly doubt the staff did.

review.title: Only in case there is no alternative
review.reviewText: Hotel is a bit loud, located at Lombard street with all its traffic noise is to be expected but to hear everything from other guests is not really satisfying. Parking space limited but it worked (no charge); Staff could be more friendly; maybe they aren't because most guests will come only once. Breakfast better to be taken outside; rel. close to Fishermans Wharf etc.; nice 10 minute walk.

review.title: Needs Updating
review.reviewText: Good location, but room was small, and bed was broken, and sloped into the middle. Traffic is loud, so make sure you are really tired when going to bed! Good walk distance to restaurants and bus route.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The service from the staff was great. The location was surprising quiet. Good experience.

review.title: Too remote
review.reviewText: Of interest..management has a policy of signing a 25 dollar assessment ahead of tme for possible use of room facilities. They do return that to charge card if you ask. I wonder how many ask????

review.title: Ok for short stay
review.reviewText: The hotel room was small and cramped. It was located on Lombard street, which is a very busy and noisy street, even during the night. The hotel is five blocks from Fishherman's Warf. The parking is free, which is a great advantage because most other hotels charge a substantial premium for parking, over and above the room rate. We stayed 2 days, which was enough, any longer and I would stay elsewhere.

review.title: Small but Very Clean
review.reviewText: We got in very late at night and had jet lag. I was disappointed at first at the size of the room. We had 2 doubles for 2 adults and 2 teens. That made the room seem small. But, everything in the city is compact. The room was very, very clean, and the managers very helpful with tours, etc. Yes, we would stay there again!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The Francisco Bay Inn had great location and is also a stop for many of the bus tours. The room was comfortable, but the hallway noise sometimes travels to the rooms. The staff was friendly and parking was free.

review.title: Great value for money
review.reviewText: The Inn is in a great location and is great value for money.. the rooms are clean and come with many amenities (for its price) such as microwave, wi-fi and fridge. The bed is comfy and the bathroom was spacious and clean.

review.title: Good Enough
review.reviewText: If you're on a tight budget and just need a place to crash at night, this place is perfect. It's clean, I didn't have any complaints with the room. It's also extremely close to the main attractions of SF. But just don't expect to be pampered.

review.title: Good enough for an over-nighter
review.reviewText: Like most of these reviews, the street noise was pretty load but we were worn out from all the walking for the day and had not trouble sleeping as the king bed was very comfy. The frig did not work but al else was fine. The massage shower head was nice in the big bath room.

review.title: Good location, helpful staff, clean
review.reviewText: This hotel is located centrally in SF. The 30 bus line is a block away and it will take you to most places. The staff was friendly and very helpful. It is in a decent part of town. The room was clean and the bathroom was large. We brought ear plugs after reading previous reviews and were very glad we did. It is located on a very busy street, and the traffic was going all night. Breakfast was minimal but since we snacked all day it was fine.

review.title: Extremely Helpful Staff!
review.reviewText: The room was small but very nicely organized and furnished, the hotel was repainted recently, and the staff was amazingly knowledgeable regarding all things SF.

review.title: Helpful Staff, Good Location, Clean!
review.reviewText: We were satisfied with this hotel choice. The bathroom was much larger than expected. We rented a car and liked the free parking. We soon found our way to Denny's or IHOP for breakfast as the hotel breakfast options were less than desirable. The hotel staff was friendly, the place was clean and we enjoyed our stay.

review.title: A Little Run Down
review.reviewText: The Good: Great location, free parking, fridge and microwave in room, accommodating staff. The Bad: Small rooms, noisy, did not change sheets from night to night. Overall: A decent value if you do not plan to spend very much time in your room.

review.title: Nothing luxurious but clean, cheap hotel
review.reviewText: We just wanted a clean place to sleep, shower, and store our stuff that was within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf. With those expectations, you will not be disappointed. The room was very clean when we arrived and was cleaned well each day we were there. The street noise was just audible from our room but it wasn't so loud that we couldn't sleep. This hotel is a comfortable walking distance from Fisherman's Wharf - about 6 or 7 blocks. The room did have a microwave and fridge which was nice. The decor is nothing special at all, the curtains and bedspread and wallpaper all clashed but who really cares as long as it's clean, comfortable, and safe which was exactly what we found here.

review.title: Was Better than I Expected
review.reviewText: I had booked this hotel before reading the aweful reviews. I was preparing myself for the worst...but the hotel turned out to be very nice. Yes it is next to a busy street, but I was still able to sleep. Since I travel alone, the room was spacious enough for my needs. I think I would stay in this hotel again if I returned to San Francisco on vacation again.

review.title: Would definately stay here again!!!
review.reviewText: We found the hotel ideally situated for Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 29 and only a short walk to the cable car terminus. The undercover cover parking was a bonus. The hotel reception staff were more than helpful, explaining places of interest to us and booking a tour that we were interested in. Nothing was too much trouble for them.

review.title: Clean /decent place at a great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel offers free parking! The room/bathrooms are clean and well maintained. The only thing that's unpleasant about the hotel is the reception Staff! They are indifferent and even impolite sometimes. Bad front desk staff! It's easy to ignore that aspect considering the great location, good price, and free parking!

review.title: Clean/good location
review.reviewText: Pleasant place to stay---I like the location---HBO didn't work---small room---but overall no real complaints

review.title: Close to the wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel was very close to Fishermans Wharf, Ghiradelli Square, and Pier 39. We were so happy that we were close enough to these places to walk to them in the mornings. It was a very nice hotel in a residential like area so it was quiet. Overall I would definitely stay there again!

review.title: OK for price in off season, wouldn't pay on season prices
review.reviewText: Noisy if room is facing the busy streets, I knew that going into the stay. The bathroom, while very nice,is 1/2 the size of the room. The room is extremely small with no closet or place for the suitcases when you have 4 staying the same room. but had a nice microwave and refrigerator. Hotel staff only available 7 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. which made it hard for late arrivals.

review.title: It is OK
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice for the price and location. The front desk lady was lukewarm and pulled different face to different customers. The breakfast was good.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Price was great, location was great.....At first the room looked perfect, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was huge, but when it came time to sleep, the walls were so thin, we could hear people from next door, outside, even the residents beneath us! waaaaaaaaaay to noisy. definitely need earplugs. However, good location, walking distance to wharf, restaurants and bars.

review.title: Good cheap, clean option in SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely nothing special. But for a hotel in San Francisco, staying on New Year's Eve, it was a very reasonable option. Plenty clean and cheap enough. Don't expect "service with a smile."

review.title: Poor service, noisy room
review.reviewText: The front desk was very unprofessional, she gave a "take it or leave it" attitude when I didn't get the room I deserve. Live in 2nd floor and noise came from upstairs and street kept me awake all night. Location is the only thing good thing in the end, but the service had already ruined the mood.

review.title: Cheap and good
review.reviewText: This is the place for you if you want to stay in San Francisco cheap but still satisfied. You will enjoy its free parking and light breakfast. Tv remote did not work, but other than that, the room was nice and clean.

review.title: Good quality and location for the price
review.reviewText: We had a room at the back of the hotel on the third floor and couldn't hear any traffic noise mentioned in some of the reviews. The room was clean but had a musty smell, probably due to the a/c not being run. The continental breakfast was decent and included muffins, croissants, danishes and donuts along with instant coffee and orange juice (get there early for the best selection). The staff was efficient if not overly friendly. The location was good, but note that the "three blocks from the cable car stop" are straight up hill. Overall a good hotel for the price.

review.title: Nice rooms, nice staff, parking is ridiculous
review.reviewText: The rooms are very clean and comfortable, and the staff of the hotel is friendly. However, there is NO parking at this place. They have a very small parking lot and are forced to stack cars, so they keep your keys at the front desk. I guess it's the same thing at every place, since San Francisco has limited parking throughout the city.

review.title: Just another room
review.reviewText: The rooms are a little small, but were really clean. The location is good if you are traveling on highway 101. The elevator makes moving bags up to the top floors nice and the noise from the road is bairly noticeable. The last note is there is no view except for the hotels across the street.

review.title: Fair, about average for 2 star
review.reviewText: The main complaint was that the room had no table or chairs. Odd, because there was a microwave & refrigerator. Bathroom was over size and in good working order. There was no closet only a rack in one corner by a lamp. When clothes were hung up light was impeded. These are the reasons for the low rating. I needed some directions to various places and I was provided with Yahoo maps at no charge. For this I was gratefull.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Looks ok from the outside but the room we had was so clean, very nicely decorated and the view was great. Parking is free but limited, so the hotel staff double parks cars and you have to wait for someone to move their car so that you can leave. The lobby smells like smoke and I didn't see any continental breakfast. Room was great. It's a good deal.

review.title: Parking is a boon
review.reviewText: Yeah, being able to park your car and walk everywhere is plus. Fisherman's Wharf couple blocks away downhill, Lombard St couple blocks away uphill, Chinatown bit further away, over some very steep hills, etc. Yes, the road is noisy, but I would think given the way architecture is in SF (Victorian-style about 3 stories, with bay windows hanging out over the streets), most streets 'catch' the noise. Lady who checked us in was bit slow but unflappable when it came to other guests problems, and that's OK as far as I am concerned.

review.title: expensive and awfull
review.reviewText: service here was bad. if you didn't get up early for breakfast there was none left - no coffe or juice was ofered even though it was only 8am! No laundry - reception would do it for 10 dollars; across the road laundry was 3 dollars! Very expensive hotel for poor service

review.title: do not recommend
review.reviewText: hotel okay...but outside noise horrible had to wear earplugs to sleep..staff okay not very nice do not recommend this hotel...

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Nice location, older hotel with clean rooms. Need to be a sound sleeper if you want to sleep past 6:00AM, lots of street noise. All things considered well worth the price based on convienence.

review.title: Was ok
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean, staff friendly. Hotel is aging. We liked the free parking. Not much room for cars though. Would recommend for someone not looking for alot of ammenities.

review.title: Great area
review.reviewText: Hotel was not as noise as I thought. The room was smaller than the picture represented, but the room was clean and comfortable for the price. Hotel was close to attractions and public transportation. I would stay there again.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Is a very clean hotel with plenty of parking. We were very impressed with this hotel.

review.title: noisy ...seriously!
review.reviewText: When I read the review of the noise, I passed it off, until I got there. There was plenty of noise, the room smelled, and the staff looked tired and not willing to go out of their way for you. "Breakfast" was a joke ..OJ, muffin, and instant coffee. Wouldn't return anytime soon.

review.title: Worth the price, very good location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very well located in Lombard Street, for my case I came by car, and did not drive again until leaving the hotel. That's good. Please consider taking breakfast somewhere else, no space to eat, should take the muffins, coffe &/or fruit back to your room. Overall, fine, clean, noisy street though I did not have any problem when sleeping. I think it worth the price for the location for a short staying. I would came again.

review.title: not impressed at all
review.reviewText: the service was not good and the beds were aweful

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: Small rooms bad service I could not get the Ac to work no extra pillows towels ect horrible

review.title: Very noisy but otherwise just fine ...
review.reviewText: I agree with the others who say this motel is very noisy. I did not hear people in the motel but heard the traffic every waking hour. If you have difficulty sleeping this motel is probably not for you; it seems the only time it was quiet was in the wee hours of the morning. The room was small but cute and clean with a fridge, coffee maker, and iron. Continental breakfast was adequate - donuts, muffins, limited fruit - and they ask that you eat it in your room. Staff was not particularly friendly but not unfriendly either.

review.title: Comfortable enough
review.reviewText: Not exactly what I had expected, but they were very accommodating and had more amenities than the more expensive hotel where I had been staying in the first part of the week.

review.title: Gracious, gracious staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and neat and the staff was unbelievably helpful. On bus lines to get anywhere in SF. It is an inexpensive but very clean, neat hotel with a staff that is as helpful as a five star without the cost. We will return many times. Free parking is great!

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: I think this is a good place to stay even if there is a lot of noise due to the traffic on Lombard Street. The location is a good point: easy access to everything in Francisco. The other good point is the parking lot.

review.title: Quality & Value
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 3 nights here, we were very impressed by the overall quality and value for money. Staff were very helpful and efficient, rooms were comfortable and clean. We would have no hesitation in returning here.

review.title: Worth the price
review.reviewText: Very Clean, close to tourist attractions, small rooms but clean and you are not paying a luxury suite price anyway. Nice place for a couple of days stay.

review.title: Worth the search
review.reviewText: This hotel offers easy access to local attractions and activities. The free parking is a plus, while it sometimes was hard to find a place in the lot due to renovation of the hotel. The hotel staff was very friendly and courteous. the housekeeping was great, service everyday! I would definately stay here again, as well as recommend to others...if you choose to stay at the Fransisco Bay Inn you will not regret it. HAPPY TRAVELING!!!

review.title: Reasonable value for the price
review.reviewText: Room good. Lot of traffic noice because on main street. Parking somewhat limited. Location good for bus service to tourist areas.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Location was pretty good, but the hotel is on a VERY busy street and it was very noisy. The hotel room was clean, but very small. We asked for more pillows, they said they had no more. Breakfest was very small, no where to sit, no plates. We were not impressed and would not stay there again.

review.title: Best Kept Secret in Fisherman's Wharf area
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very helpful and graciously answered all our questions. It is located within walking distance to FW. The parking is tight but we did not even use our rental car except to drive to the wine country. My friends and I would most definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good location, good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine for the price. Our room did not have a closet, and parking even a small car was a challenge in the crowded, narrow stalls, but otherwise the Francisco Bay Inn is a great deal for the money compared to other SF hotels in the FW area.

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: The Francisco Bay Inn was the cutest hotel! Located on busy Lombard Street, and just 5 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf it's a perfect place to stay at the perfect price! Our room was situated on Lombard Street so by 9am the sound of the cars woke us up, but we were gone until evening when it quieted down...the 3rd floor was also very warm, but the A/C worked fantastically to cool it off...oh, and the bathroom was huge (we stayed in a non-smoking room with a single King bed). They are currently remodeling the outside, but you'd never know it, they are so quiet! Staff is very helpful and friendly. We'll be back!

review.title: nice hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel comparing the price x ammenities. Just one little prolem: it was too cold and the guests have to pick up the coffee downstairs.

review.title: It's good!
review.reviewText: even though they were doing construction outside of their buildings...their services and hospitality were excellent!!!!!

review.title: Great for the money.
review.reviewText: This hotel was very comfortable, and convienently located in the city. It is a little loud from the street noise, but I don't think there are too many hotels in San Fran that won't have the same problem.

review.title: very helpful staff
review.reviewText: the staff at this hotel were extreamly eager to help us with our plans. they explained the transit system so that we were able to take the buses or streetcars all over the city.

review.title: The best cost benefit ever!
review.reviewText: Francisco Bay Inn is far the best option on it's price range. This was the first time we used expedia.com and were a bit concerned about what we were actually paying for! First you must consider the fact that Fisherman's Warf is an expensive place to stay, but sure the nicest one. Easy to get in and around, you can simply walk and see the best of San Francisco from the hotel or use the MUNI pass from right around the corner. The staff are very helpfull getting you around. Truelly, there is no meaning spending more somewhere else! Look foward seeing you again!!!

review.title: Great Lodging near Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: My wife and I were extremely impressed with the Francisco Bay Inn, a moderately priced hotel about 12 blocks from Pier 39. The room was clean (remodeled in 2002)and included a refrigerator and microwave, a 27" television with expanded cable, and a very large bathroom which had ample room for the iron/ironing board. The owners and staff were far above average in both pleasantness and in providing information. Located one block off Van Ness, a major artery for using the convenient MUNI buses, we found no need to drive in the city and fight downtown parking problems. The Inn's free parking is adequate, although a bit crowded at the moment (December '04) while they remodel the third floor rooms. The Inn's location was also free of panhandlers, who are frequent and pushy in the downtown/Union Square hotel areas. We intend to return to this same facility in March '05, and heartily look forward to staying with these friendly and efficient folks.

review.title: Excellent service!
review.reviewText: If you look for a hotel moderately priced and don't mind close to Union Square, then this is the place to be! Very large room, free parking, wireless Internet, excellent service and two guys at the helpdesk extremely helpful and gentle! What can you ask more??

review.title: hotel review
review.reviewText: I am annoyed that I have to fill this in all I wanted to let you know was that they were nice
